I will definitely be back. The Pod offers a great option for those who need a simple, no frills room at a decent price.

title: Perfetto!
text:
Hotel a Midtown in zona super comoda. L’albergo è moderno, pulito e offre una comoda zona relax in cui è possibile fruire del caffè/tè gratuitamente ogni mattina. Il personale è gentile e super disponibile (abbiamo avuto dei problemi durante il check in in quanto le nostre carte non venivano accettate e i ragazzi della reception sono stati veramente disponibili e ci hanno aiutato in tutti i modi possibili. Non li ringrazierò mai abbastanza). 
La nostra stanza, una doppia con bagno in camera e letto a castello, era all’11 piano ed aveva tutto il necessario per un pernottamento.
Dovessi tornare a NY, sicuramente tornerei al POD39

title: Amazing
text:
We loved our stay at the Pod39.
I’ve already suggested it to my friends who are going to go to NY next fall. 
The location was amazing (just 2 streets from Grand Central and the subway), the room was pretty big for Manhattan.

title: Amazing staff!
text: We booked this hotel because it was economical, and were pleasantly surprised at how many amenities were included with this budget hotel. The staff was always available, friendly, and helpful. The rooftop bar had a great vibe. Rooms are small, but had everything we needed, and were cleaned daily. Very happy with our visit and will definitely be returning to Pod 39 on future visits to NYC.

title: super cozy
text: If you dont plan on hanging out in the room very much this is great. The lounge area was cozy and they had ping pong tables and a pool table. The rooftop bar/restaurant had great views, but no seats at the bar just tables and benches around it, it was packed when I went, had to wait to find somewhere to sit or even stand at a hightop table. The rooms are TINY, as advertised but they were smaller than the photos made it look. I stayed in a double with a friend and the lack of floor space made it a bit difficult to open our suitcases at the same time. She only stayed one night with me, the other nights I was alone and it was the perfect size. I didn't see any other rooms, but if you're with a friend the bunk beds might be better, if you're with a significant other then the double would probably be fine.

title: Simple, Comfortable, & all you need
text:
My twin single bed was perfect for my solo trip! POD39 location was great and I felt super safe. The bed was very comfortable, and I loved having my own little bathroom with a rain shower head. I can’t complain about a single thing! Will stay here again if I am in New York.
I will say, the restaurant staff/food/value didn’t do it for me - it was nothing in compared to my other city experiences.

title: Good Place to Stay If You Don't Mind Small Room
text: Extremely small room, but well equipped with necessities, good shower, safe and phone.  The bed has clever compartments to serve as a chest of drawers. TV has a lot of channels. And great location. Midtown Manhattan on the East Side, a few blocks from Grand Central and easy walking distance to Times Square.  Nice lounge, but could stay open past 10pm. Better than spartan, but, again, prepare for tiny room.

title: Perfect Location
text: I really liked how Pod 39 was close to Times Square without being near the hustle and bustle. It was a quiet location and the rooftop bar gave nice views of NYC. An added bonus was free coffee in the mornings.

title: Clean, compact rooms; good location; no-frills
text:
Location: The hotel is 4 blocks away from Grand Central and an easy walk to Times Square (42nd) and Macy's (34th). 

Rooms: Rooms are super-compact and fairly bare-bones, but very neat and clean. Do note that there is no minifridge, no kettle/coffee machine, and no toiletries apart from soap, shampoo, conditioner and body wash. (If, like me, the airline lost your bags, you'll need to step out and buy a toothbrush and toothpaste.) There is also no stand on which to open your suitcase, but there is space under the bed to store it, as well as a drawer for your stuff. There is a small amount of storage space, as well as a small safe to store your valuables/passport etc. I didn't use it but it will probably also fit an iPad or compact laptop. Power sockets are by the desk so a bit of a reach if you like to have your phone next to you when sleeping. Room came equipped with a small TV on the wall, I didn't make use of it though. The room is comfortable for one person, probably a little tight for two, especially if you're not a couple - the bathroom has a frosted glass partition for a wall so getting ready in the morning may be a bit of a challenge in terms of privacy. Housekeeping comes around every morning and you can choose whether you'd like them to make up your room while you're out - I chose not to since I was only there for 4 nights, though I did have them take the trash whenever they came by. If you have the choice, take a room on a higher floor for a better view and more light - I was on the 12th floor. 

Front Desk: very polite, helpful, efficient. There is typically a resort fee that is payable over and above the room rate+tax -  it was $22.95/night as of July 2022. They will also take a security deposit of $30/night (avg) at checkin which will be refunded to you on checkout. Front desk also kindly stored my bags for a few hours after checkout as I had a train out later in the day. 

Other facilities: there is a fitness center that I did not have the chance to use, I'm not sure if you need to pay extra to access it. There is no breakfast to speak of - coffee, tea, and granola bars are served every morning from around 7 to 10, so plan accordingly. There's a Shake Shake around the corner on 3rd, and a deli at the corner of Lexington, so you can always plan to eat there. There is also a nice dimsum place right across from the deli if that's more your speed.

Overall, would recommend, though you should know exactly what you get for what you're paying.

title: Lovely location
text: Great, safe location, close to Chrysler Building, Grand Central Terminal and subway stations. nice people, free coffee and water every morning. Rooms are not so big, but for me it wasn't really important. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable

title: Easy place to stay in Midtown
text: See previous page for my full comments.  Love the coffee and tea in the mornings!  Please include tops for the coffee and tea.  Think about adding breakfast bars and fresh fruit!  And love the rooftop bar.   Very scenic and festive there.   Really good sheets and pillows in the rooms.   Liked the price in July.

title: Solid, Clean, Well-ran Hotel
text: The Pod 39 is a fantastic property that is a great value for the location and condition of the rooms / amenities. Staff was great and the location simply cannot be beat. The room itself was generously sized (for manhattan) and everything was clean and tidy.

title: Quite good
text:
The stay was fine. Great staff and location. Also wifi worked. But what annoyed was the mattrass which was old and soft and i woke up every day with backpain.
Si, in overall it is ok just for night but i recommend earplugs.

title: +location
text:
good location, clean rooms, size of romms for new york was expected,
had to turn ac off because it was very cold but thats not a problem which has to do with the hotel more characters needed for what ?

title: Small rooms but great place!
text: Very clean and nice staff. Comfortable common spaces compensate for small rooms.  Used room only to sleep. Bunk beds were very comfortable but room pretty cramped. Good price and value for New York City.  Area is safe.

title: Very good location but wifi signal was very poor
text: La ubicación y limpieza del hotel son excelentes. El único punto a mejorar quizá sea el wifi del hotel. Lo necesitaba por trabajo y estudio y realmente no funcionaba muchas veces. Fuera de eso es un hotel recomendable

title: Amazing stay!
text: I’ve stayed at the Pod numerous times and must say, this is one of my fav hotels in Manhattan. Very clean, easily accessible and walkable, I truly find this place to be a gem. I frequented the restaurant this time and was pleasantly pleased by the accommodating staff. Overall, a great stay

title: Pod 39
text: We really enjoyed our stay - lovely rooftop bar at Pod 39, friendly staff, a clean room, and great location. The room was small, but that was expected. We had a queen bed, and a lovely south view of Manhattan through two windows in our room. We would stay in a Pod hotel again!

title: Minimal ma perfetto
text: Io e il mio ragazzo abbiamo deciso di soggiornare al POD39 durante la nostra visita a New York. Essendo una città da vivere abbiamo apprezzato l’arredamento minimal della stanza, vivendola solamente per la notte. A due passi da grand central per noi è stato un alloggio top. Avevamo una stanza al settimo piano, con visuale interna. Per la vista siamo saliti sul roof top per un drink la sera, poco turistico quindi esperienza da local centrata e vista ottima per essere al 17 piano. Consigliatissimo.

title: Small but good
text:
Der Raum ist sehr klein, doch sehr sauber und gut riechend. Das Bett war überraschend bequem.
Perfektes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis für NYC.
Und das Beste: die Rooftop-Bar mit einer Traumaussicht über Manhattan

title: Cute room in a great location
text: The rooftop bar was beautiful with views of the city and a friendly bartender. In fact, every staff I interacted with was delightful. They gave me an extra mask when I asked. This hotel is clean, aesthetic and fun perfect for solo travelers. The room isn’t too small - I could walk with no problem. I would love to stay again next time I’m in town.

title: Fantastic Roof Top Bar Views!
text: People need to understand the rooms are tiny, but has everything you need. No street noise at all in the room. Staff was fantastic. They held my luggage after checkout at no cost. Very pleased with my stay.

title: The Best in NYC
text: This hotel is the best place to stay. Clean, friendly staff and idea location. Its nice to be in a neighborhood and yet so easy to get everywhere. I reccomend the House of Lasagna on the corner of 39th and Lex.

title: Efficient accommodations, great location & reasonable price!
text: Great place to stay for the traveler who is a city explorer and doesn’t stay in their room all day! Rooms are efficient providing everything you need and the rooftop bar is a great place to enjoy a drink and meet people to conclude your evening!

title: Great location, great staff
text:
I spent 6 night in Pod39.
Great location, you can reach every place easily with metro.
Great staff, gentle and polite, people available and adorable.
The room is small, of course we're in NY, but clean and conformtable.
Honest price.

title: Comme Ci, Comme Ça
text: Only staff complaint I could possibly have would be that we asked for new towels and never received them, other than that it’s one of the best hotel staff I have ever encountered, also nobody knew about the parking arrangements and the icon parking people are running an entire scam without the pod39 staff knowing

title: Sweet spot to stay
text:
Sweet spote for stay for those who wants to travle ang hangout in New york 
Very kind a d respectfull staff . 
 5 min walking to the subway trian station  and the location is great in the middle of Manhattan

title: A excellent location
text: A hotel with excellent location, good and clean room, organized reception and good price to Manhattan. My room was quiet and clean. All my questions were answered very quickly… Everything was perfect.

title: Nunca he tenido peor experiencia
text: Estoy con una cría de cuatro años durmiendo en el hall del hotel ahora mismo. Es nuestro segundo día de estancia de una semana, y dicen que el cobro no les ha llegado. En mi banco el dinero aparece cobrado, y se lo muestro. No me dejan entrar hasta que no lo arregle, cosa que obviamente no puede hacerse de inmediato. Inaudito. Vamos a estar siete días y hemos mostrado toda la información del pago, lo mínimo es dejarnos pasar y darnos tiempo para arreglarlo con el banco. Vergonzoso

title: Top Hotel
text: Vlotte check-in. Vriendelijk onthaald. Mooie Queens-room die net voldoende ruim is met zeer comfortabel bed en praktische badkamer. Zeer toffe rooftop bar! Gezellige gemeenschappelijke ruimte. Ligt heel centraal gelegen!!

title: Great very good located location
text:
We have visited New York for sightseeing for 6 days and stayed in the Pod39.  From there everything is reachable by walking (To Manhattan takes 60min). Main locations like Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, Time Square are very close (5-20min). We are happy that we had chosen this location.

We are very happy that we had chosen the Pod39.

title: Great Value
text: I very much enjoyed my stay at POD 39. Room was clean, efficient, and perfectly priced. My only complaint is that there is no place in the hotel to access filtered drinking water. You have to walk to the bodega down the street to purchase water, soda, snacks etc...

title: Great business hotel
text: Rooms--even the Queen Room is quite tiny compared to most hotels. Nevertheless it serves its purpose and the bed was comfortable. No complaints about cleanliness, linen and towel supply, WiFi and electrical outlets. All well-managed. I'd suggest that the hotel offers as a option an electric kettle to customers who want or need to make their daily tea/coffee... the 'free' morning coffee in the lounge/bar is quite dire.

title: Almost perfect
text:
The only problem I had was with the wifi. Otherwise, everything was perfect. We were able to check-in earlier since there was a room available, it was suuuuper clean, the staff was great, the rooftop is nice and we were able to leave our luggage in a storage room on the last day.

The room was small but we already knew what we were getting into when we booked. It is perfect for friends travelling or just people wanting to save money and who don't care about the size of the room

The location is great, the hotel is a 5 min walk from Grand Central Terminal and 20min walk from Time Square.

title: Great hotel for solo traveler.
text:
I stayed here a week and it was great overall. The beds were clean and comfy, the shower was great and the staff was excellent!
I would recommend a solo traveler or a couple to stay here and would not hesitate to come back.

title: Sophia’s stay
text:
My stay was good. Staff are very helpful and professional. The facility is well situated with easy access to several places within walking distance. 
Cleanliness is great. Bedding and towels are of good quality, clean and white.
Management should consider providing body lotion and also water kettles in the rooms.

title: A great choice in Manhattan
text: The Pod 39 Hotel is located close to everything you need. This ranges from convenience stores, breakfast and restaurant to transportation such as the subway. The room we stayed at was cleaned daily and with amazing results. The hotel has a rooftop bar that has great views, but likewise with the hotel comes with a steep price. If you don’t mind paying a bit more for the location, then this is a safe option when visiting New York.

title: Nice stay, friendly staff
text: All staff was very friendly. The bunk room was perfect for my son and I.  Nice neighborhood, away from the hustle and bustle but close to everything.  I would definitely stay here again if we ever came back to NYC.

title: Very clean and new hotel
text:
Very modern, well located and clean hotel. Rooms have everything one can need. They provide coffee, tea and milk in the morning in a common room nicely decorated. This space is open during the whole day and it has tables, sofas and ping-pong tables.
I’d repeat undoubtedly :)

title: A Little Gem in Murray Hill
text: This was our first stay at this particular Pod hotel.  We usually stay at Pod 51 but it was full when we booked.  Our room was pretty small; only full pod rooms were available and we like to stay in Queen, but after a day or two we became accustomed to the space.  We were on the 13th floor next to the elevator.  Thankfully, the elevator was not an issue.  We love the free walking tours that the Pod offers and took advantage of two this stay.  We had to go to the Times Square Pod to meet up for one and to Pod 51 for the other as no tours start from this hotel.  The hotel is very convenient to Grand Central Station.  There is a good breakfast place on Lexington called Bagel Express that we frequented each morning.  For dinner, we ate at Wagamama, which was good and very reasonable, on 3rd Avenue and the House of Lasagna on Lexington, a little more expensive but also quite good.  The rooftop is an excellent place to hang out.  The bar is open from 4 to 9 p.m. and attracts a lot of people in good weather.  There is also a cool neighborhood bar called the Junction on Lexington right across the street.  We had one issue in our room:  there was no body wash in the shower when we arrived.  I told the front desk and it was taken care of that day.  All in all, very happy with this place.

title: Great place to stay in midtown
text: My friend and I had a great stay! The location was so central but not overly noisy (the usual sirens were fine). The lobby area was really cool for a hang out space, and the rooftop bar had amazing views and a fun atmosphere. The room itself was just what we needed, AC was definitely a plus!

title: Pod 39 is Great!
text: Although the rooms are small it was clean and well organized, and very quite at night. The hotel had a great rooftop patio plus a great shared space on the main floor. Great location, very walkable. Finally the staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Great hotel
text: Great stay at the Pod - a budget hotel with everything you could need in the heart of Manhattan. Rooms are small but fine for a couple (would recommend a Queen room). Dog was barking a bit one day but the receptionist sorted straight away. Rooftop bar is a great bonus too!

title: Couldn't be better.
text:
Super convenient location close to Grand Central Station, the Newark Espress, Bryant Park and Times Square.
Very clean all over.
Friendly and helpfull staff.
Rooftop bar open if weather permits.
Breakfast options close by.

title: Great location.  Great value.
text: Having stayed at Pod properties many times, I knew exactly what to expect.  Not a two bedroom suite -- but certainly all I need.  In fact, the smaller room makes it very easy top pack for the return home.

title: Great Value in Murray Hill
text:
Pod 39 is a great place to stay if you're visiting NYC. It's located in Murray Hill, a midtown east neighborhood that's teeming with restaurants but, most of all, is located a quick and easy walk away to Grand Central Station, where you can light out anywhere you want in Manhattan and the boroughs via the subway.

The hotel itself is great: fair prices for a clean, efficient room. The beds are terrific for a good night's sleep; the rain shower feature adds a touch of welcome luxury. It's a busy hotel, with lots of guests; the elevators are quick and efficient.

The most important aspect to bear in mind: the rooms are small. Just large enough to fit a bed, bath, wall-mounted TV, and small desk. The logic being you'll spend most of your time in the city, not in your hotel room. If you're in a family or group larger than 2, you'd need more than 1 room; 2 people max can fit a room snugly. That limit acknowledged, for the location and value, Pod 39 is well worth it!

title: loved it
text: this to me is the american version of the japaneese pods.  no frills, a bed and a bathroom.  it was small but comfy.  the location is good in manhattan.  it has all i need.  the staff was great for me vary nice and helpful..  if i was going to manhattan i wold stay here

title: Excellent service and room
text: great experience. the location of the hotel is excellent, close to grnd central station and bryant park. The room was nice and clen and the stuff friendly and helpful.  I had a great time and I would definitely come back.

title: Short overnight stay
text: Room was small, as expected, but comfortable and workable. We arrived late in the evening, and checked out fairly early the next morning. This was a great place to stay for a comfortable overnight. We did not have a lot of belongings or stay in the room except to sleep one night, so the size was not an issue, and the price was so much better than surrounding 'regular' hotels!

title: Great location/value for money!
text: Overall loved out stay! Be aware of extremely loud A/C in the room (if sensitive to noise) & bring a jumper for the lounge room as the A/C is full on all the time. Otherwise great location, confortable rooms, shower room is great.

title: LOVE IT!
text: Great location, super clean, friendly staff and it has a rooftop bar. Near to Central Park, penn station, time square, Macys and the Empire Building. Close to many of the train stations, buses and good restaurants around. Highly recommended

title: No frizzle but perfect for a short stay
text:
Yes the room is small, maybe it is in the name of the hotel…., but the bed and shower are comfy, staff is friendly and the location is oh so good! 
Affordable and Manhattan, what else do you want? Nice rooftop

only minor thing is, you can’t turn on/off the lights from the bed. which is annoying.

title: Séjour 1 semaine
text:
Excellent emplacement, le métro a proximité 
Personnel super 
Calme, chambre très petite idem salle de bain, très bonne literie, terrasse de toit très sympa. Pas de petit dej  mais beaucoup de possibilités à proximité 
Très bon rapport qualité prix, je recommande cet hôtel

title: Excelente
text: En general muy buena experiencia, la ubicación excelente, había limpieza todos los días, cómoda la habitación a pesar de ser pequeña, había disponibilidad de agua y café, te guardan maletas en el check out durante un tiempo y eso ayuda mucho.

title: What I needed, but could have been better With little
text: They have a great lounge, but the bar is always empty, not even a expending  machine. If you get there late, not even water. Both parts could really profit by putting some things for sale. The rooms are small but well distributed

title: Easy and simple stay!
text: Planned a trip with me and my daughter to stay here and it was a perfect place for us! Easy check in and check out! The staff was all super friendly the entire stay. The room was the perfect size and clean. Definitely would stay again.

title: Pod 39 stay
text:
The location is great.  Very convenient to get around by buses and train.  Variety of restuarants and shops in close proximity.  
When I opened the door to my room I thoght I was still outside.  The room was very small and very bare.   No microwave, no fridge, not even a coffee pot.  The accomodation to me is below average.  In my opinion it is only good for a one night stay some place to rest your head, but not for lengthly stays.  Hope some improvements in the regards I mentioned could be made, because the location is really great.

title: Très bon emplacement
text: Très bon hôtel, super emplacement très proche de Times square et du metro tu peux tout visiter à pieds, les chambres sont certes petites mais très propre et confortable, chose que j'ai pas apprécié c'est tu dois avoir une carte visa pour le deposet

title: less is more
text: My daughter and I had a nice stay at Pod39. Room was clean and simple. Staff was friendly and helpful. You get what you see and nothing more. The location is hard to beat if you need Grand Central close.

title: Awful management & a poor excuse of a hotel.
text: Multiple issues from start to finish leaking shower, no volume control on tv, shutters let in all the light so no sleep. Both bars & restaurant were closed & at no point on booking or check-in was I informed. So no facilities at all available in the hotel & paid a fortune for this hotel purely on the fact it HAD a roof top bar. If I’d been informed I’d have stayed somewhere else. When I brought it to the attention of the manager he swiftly replied I can checkout if I like. No offer to fix any of my issues!!! Disgusting treatment. Do not waste your money on this place. After my experience not even the rooftop bar would make up stay here staff were beyond rude. So don’t make the mistake of booking this poor attempt at a hospitable hotel, complete lack of hospitality.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix et bonne situation
text:
Réservation de deux chambres, une pour nos ados, avec lits superposés et une autre avec un lit 2 places 
La situation est plutôt sympa avec grand central Terminal juste à côté, idem pour le SUMMIT, et l'empire state Building pas très loin.
Le rapport qualité prix est très bon, malheureusement restos et bar de l'hôtel pas ouvert avant le mois de mai, idem pour le rooftop, dommage.
A noter toutefois que le personnel d'accueil ne fait pas beaucoup d'efforts pour communiquer quand on est pas super à l'aise en Anglais...mais pour le reste c'est un hôtel idéal pour maîtriser le budget.

title: Clean and serves its purpose, but don't expect something great
text: The cleaning staff was really nice but people at the front desk were definitely not, they helped you out because they had to, but nobody is able to at least say good morning before asking what you need. The rooms are ok, very small but serve their purpose, very clean, but they don't have a couple things I think are essential like a microwave and a small fridge, I was there for 5 days and I struggled a lot with not having these commodities. Good location a lot of things close including food stablishments and delis.

title: My worst stay in NY
text: My worst experience in NY ever. Good location, close to Grand Central Station. Room is like expected, small but enough, but the pipes noises….terrible. When you or your neighbors open the shower tap…OMG, terrible noises. Cleaning service is not the best. Ok you can live with that but the worst thing: employees. The billing service is the worst I ever seen. I arrived in May, 6th in the evening. In the morning they charged 152€ (held money)to my credit card, that’s correct but on arrival they charged 906€ (held money). I asked to the receptionist why. He said that I should pay a security extra charge ( will be refund at the end of the stay). I booked on Booking.com (All the taxes and extra charges were paid). Then another receptionist (Veronica) said to me I did not know what I was talking about. Excuse me?. I am 52 and I have been working in hotels for the last 25 years, may be you don’t know what are you talking about miss. Then her  colleague said to me: THIS IS NY. What?. If I visit NY you can do what you want? (this is my 7th stay in NY by the way). You are mistaken man!. Well, they insisted again and again and was 10.30 pm (after 11 hours flying). Tomorrow will be a new day. Early in the morning I talked to Willi (Night Shift), a really good guy!. He said their colleagues made a mistake (obviously). “He released my money” and charged the correct rate (725€ held). Well, two days later I did’t have money in my account. Again to the front desk asking about that. I decided to talk to the front desk manager (Brian) after talk to my bank (37€ for the phone call). Correct he said. You are right. I know but what about my money? (1800€ approx). Well, I will release your money (again) I will send an email to you for your bank. I will call to our bank asking for a fast release. Well how long will it take?. I don’t know ?????. Tomorrow I will be leaving NY and I don’t have my money and I don’t know how long will it take so….If you what to have your money safe don’t stay in this hotel. Oh, one more thing, they charged 759€ and the correct rate was 733€. A 5 years old child could do a better work the those employees (except Willi and Brian). Hope to see my money soon. I said it to Brian. You can be New Yorkers, you can live in one of the best countries in the world but you are not better than other people. In fact, your salary is coming from us. They said they have less visitors than before the COVID. What do you expect working like  this, talking to your guests like this?. I just arrive to Spain. 2 days after talking to the front desk manger and 6 days after talking to the receptionists, the money is not release

title: A New Pod Fan!
text: Loved my 2 night stay on 15th floor! No view to speak of, but 3 functional windows! Bed was extremely comfortable and room had everything I needed. The air system was a bit uncomfortable though as it blows straight down from the ceiling onto pillow area, which is quite brisk. I did not feel comfortable leaving windows wide open during night, as there were no screens, so I got a bit hot. Bathroom is right next to bed, but door closes and is frosted for privacy if room is shared. Rooftop closes at 8pm and rooftop bar was closed. Common room was a bit loud with both tv and music playing both evenings I stopped in there, but seemed a bit calmer in mornings. They sell beer and wine for just $5! I was able to store luggage for free and walk to Bryant Park easily! Would definitely stay here again! Staff went above and beyond!

title: Great value in a great location
text: The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in.  Yes, the room is tiny and the your clothes hang above a table, but there is a safe, a drawer for your stuff and your suitcase goes under the bed.  I had 3 windows in my room with shutters and I loved the rainfall shower. The only thing that would make the room better would be a mini fridge. Pod 39 is a great value for the price.

title: not as nice as it seems
text: rooftop close and no one to tell you why! not notified anywhere in their website. I would never pay this price for a 13m2 room if it was not because of a rooftop! noisy nights.. poor light in the room and staff not so friendly for a place like that. great location and clean room but sure you can find better easily :)

title: Wer hier gebucht hat, hat alles richtig gemacht….
text:
Ich war 6 Nächte dort und habe mich rundum wohl gefühlt .!!
Ja, die Zimmer die sind recht klein, aber zweckmäßig eingerichtet.
Das Bett ist bequem……
Die Dusche ist heiss…
und bei der Sauberkeit war auch alles sehr gut.
Das Personal ist auch sehr höflich und hilfreich …

Was soll ich noch schreiben? 
Wer hier gebucht hat , hat alles richtig gemacht !!!!!!!

title: Ok
text: It was ok but the internet wouldn't work in my room and no one really cared. Service could be a bit better. On the plus side, although the rooms are, of course, small, they are very clean and the beds are comfortable. Location is perfect.

title: Bad experience
text:
The internet didn’t work. We complained so they changed to another room
The room has a bad smell
The bathroom walls are glass so you can see everything 
The rooms are very tiny
Good things: the hotel is close to everything, the hall is beautiful

title: Clean, modern, well located, no frill.
text: Pod 39 Hotel is near Grand Central Station close to everything. The rooms are small, very clean, quiet, modern and functional. if you want to stay in Midtown, I definitely recommend this hotel. The solo room was perfect for my one night stay.

title: Pod 39 Review
text: Centrally located, easy access to public transportation, clean rooms, and friendly staff.  I often stay at Pod 39 when I am visiting New York City. I have recommended it to friends and family and they like the vibe.

title: Great location!
text:
The roomsize was okay, the bar was great, unfortunately the rooftopbar was closed due to renovations. It will reopen next week. Second week of May.

Location was great, close to subway of Grand Central station.

title: In the hearth of Manhattan
text:
Perfect location in the heart of Manhattan (less than 10 minutes walking to Grand Central and around 15’ from Times Square). The room was pretty small but cozy: fully equipped including desk and chair, clothes hangers, shoes rack and locker not in the pictures I attached. The restroom was pretty big with all the product dispensers and hairdryer. Everyone was so nice and helpful and the cleaning was excellent. 
Debit cards are accepted. 
I will definitely come back in the future!

title: Nice stay in random hotel with small rooms but good beds and a good location
text:
We stayed for 5 days and nights. Welcome was short and basic. The rooms were small, clean and good beds and warm showers!
The rooftop bar was closed, the coffee in the morning complimentary but often empty…
Nevertheless a good located place to stay if tou just need a place to sleep.

title: Nice but expensive for the services
text:
Nice Hotel but expensive for the service offered 
Very well located and nice staff. My single room was very tiny; I asked for a spare chair I was denied. The room was clean and tidy. The furniture is well designed to optimize the space. No fridge no cattle, just tea or coffee in the common space between 7:00 and 10:00.
I had to change my first room for a power problem, lost my baggage locker, never found again. 
The reception flexibility was appreciated, as I had to leave one day earlier, still I found the rate too high for the room dimensions and the services offered. 241$ single usage for a Friday night… quite high.Thanks anyway.

title: Nice hotel with small rooms on perfect spot in the city
text: We liked the hotel and found the location perfect. The bed was very good and de sanitair also. We discovered Manhattan out of this location and found it very nice. In de neighborhood of the hotel are many interesting spots to pay a visit. For a next visit I would choose this hotel again.

title: Quiet and good value!
text: Perfect hotel for NYC. Aren't in your room much so no big room needed just the basics. Very clean, quiet street at night, convenient location. Near restaurants and short walk from everything. Just what was needed.

title: Wonderful
text: Wonderful position few minutes Grand Central Station e Public Library clean and cosy, you have to use the key for the lift good price little room but top view. Check out at noon !!! The room are ideal for family or young friend. Bathroom with a glass so you ve to be very closed.

title: 10 days in Pod 39
text: The hotel is very well located, just 3 blocks from the subway. Rooms are small but fine for a couple. Shower was great and always had hot water. Housekeeping staff were great and hotel receptionists were helpful. Only downsides were that the room was dusty which led to both of us having a cough and there is no mini fridge.

title: The Mysterious Case of the Quiet New York Hotel Experience
text:
I came to the city with a friend to glut on theater after a two year hiatus. My friend has stayed at Pod39 many times before, and always enjoys it. it is a great location, easy to walk to the theaters and close proximity to Grand Central and subway stations. 
The staff was friendly, professional and helpful. The main spaces are very clean and well kept as are the rooms, hallways, elevators. I really quite loved my tiny ships berth room. Simple, comfortable and the pocket door on the subway tiled bath/shower area is genius in space utilization. Comfortable simple bed. I enjoyed having a window (that opened!) and a sweet urban view of the bricks of our building as well as blue skies and the tops of other nearby buildings. Enjoyed the wide variety of international travelers, multiple languages and the overall vibe of travelers not tourists. 
I was most taken with the quiet in the halls. I heard zero noises of drunken people coming and going, televisions, traffic noise. It was quite fabulous and certainly unusual. 
I am grateful for whatever magic cone of silence cloaked my room. 
I very much look forward to returning and spending sometime on that rooftop bar patio.

title: Pod39
text:
Rooms are very small, kept hitting.me legs on bedframe queen sized room. Struggled to move around the room, very tight.

Ground flr bars and roof terrace bar closed for renovation until fall 2022. No mention on Pod39 app, or website. Lack of communication.

Advertised happy hour 4-8pm which did not happen as bars closed.

Not enough staff at reception on checkout and no mention of $150 security deposit.

title: Great little find!
text:
I came with a group of 4 friends. We had a great stay. The hotel is in a brilliant location. Facilities were good.
Comfortable beds. Toiletries in the room. Functioning air con. Rooms cleaned every day.

title: Okay for the price.
text:
The rooms are not properly designed.  There is no space for two normal suitcases in the room.  In some photos there was space under the bed, but not in all rooms there is.

As for the bathroom door, it would have to be completely opaque.  If you go with a friend, it can see you from the bed doing your business lol.

title: Good location and stuff
text: Good location, easy access, kind stuff and clean rooms. You can keep your luggage before and after check-in. Quite rooms, daily clean sheets and towels. Price/perfomance place to stay in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Grata sorpresa
text:
Cuando contrate el hotel y su habitación de 8m2 me esperaba una cosa que termino no siendo. 
La habitación cómoda en su justa medida, y moderna!! Algo nunca visto en nyc en hoteles de ese precio. Todo nuevo, bien mantenido, enchufes por todos lados y bien resuelto. El baño era con medidas normales, no reducido en espacio, y la ducha con sorprendente presión y temperatura óptima del agua. Por otro lado algo que debería pasar en todos los hoteles (pero en este momento escribo desde un holiday inn y no está pasando…) todos los días limpiaban la habitación, reponían las toallas, cambiaban las sábanas, etc. 

El hotel también está muy bien ubicado, la zona no es de 10, pero que esté a tres cuadras de la grand central es un lujo.

No tengan dudas, si te lo venden como algo
Cápsula o lo que fuera no compren el relato y vayan igual

title: Great location, nice hotel!
text: My friend and I were very comfortable in one of the bunk-bed rooms. We thought the room design/layout was very clever.  The staff were all very helpful and the location was super convenient. It was perfect for traveling friends!

title: Excellent, for a single traveler
text:
Pretty bare bones room, but that's kind of the point. Bed and pillows were remarkably clean and comfortable and probably the best part of the room. The bathroom wasn't as small as some other NYC "full size" hotels, but there is absolutely no privacy between the room and bathroom. I could see directly to the front door of the room through a large gap in the sliding door from the toilet. There's also no form of exhaust fan in the bathroom, so I was concerned I'd set the smoke detector off with a hot shower. Would recommend for single travelers, not for couples or groups unless they're very close (even with the bunk rooms).

Hotel is steps from Grand Central and surrounded by a variety of food options and a drug store.

title: Muy buena localización y limpio
text: Hotel muy recomendable! muy buena calidad-precio y la localización perfecta para moverte con facilidad andando y está cerca del metro. Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero las mantienen siempre muy limpias

title: Best budget boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan!
text:
My review is way overdue. Pod 39 really is the best budget hotel in NYC. First off, a shoutout to the wonderful staff! Frankie, Maya, Jenae, Matthew, William, and the manager Brian Mason are all fantastic!!!!Super helpful and nice. Everyone on staff is pleasant and super eager to help with my room, and any hotel requests. 
The rooms are tiny, but modern, clean and well appointed. Comfortable beds, good showers. Perfect for one person. 
Pod 39 is so convenient. Especially if you arrive at JFK or take the train into Grand Central. 
As a woman staying alone in the hotel, I always felt safe in the hotel and neighborhood. I do wish refrigerators in the room were an option. But otherwise, if you are looking for a clean, safe and convenient budget hotel, Pod 39 is your best bet in Manhattan. Thanks to everyone!! I had a terrific recent six night stay!! See you all soon!

title: Murray Hill experience
text: Located between 3rd and Lexington on 39 th Street. Short walk to Grand Central Station. Safe. Coffee Shops around.mostly younger guests. Quiet room on 14th floor with 3 tiny windows. Very comfy bed. Clean. Fresh towels every day !? Extremely kind and helpful staff at reception. Would definitively stay there again.

title: Good for location and price!
text: Location is excellent for the price, as advertised. However, front desk staff on night duty requires hospitality training. We could do with a friendlier attitude after long hours of flight and traveling.

title: Nice surprise
text:
With a modern way off management. Access with only a card to elevators, rooms. A salloon with a very nice decoration. The Room was very clean and has a hair dryer
.The linen and towels too. You can order meals by a qr code .They have a luggage store and print papers for you . Young and happy staff. Wil return certainly 
I hope.

title: Ok
text: Location was ok, near time square and central station.Price/quality was ok. Rooms were a bit small and the mattress was a little uncomfortable, it gave us back pain. Service and cleanliness were good.

title: Great hotel, especially on a budget
text: Good value for the stay, nice amenities, very clean, small pod-like space, but ease of access. Check-in is at 3pm, but they will store bags for you. They come in and make up the beds each day. They provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in communal containers.

title: Basic Hotel for a Good Price in an EXPENSIVE City
text:
Here's an important thing to remember about New York: Hotels are expensive. What Pod 39 offers is a no-frills, but comfortable and clean hotel room. Are the rooms small? yes. Can you hear people in the hallways? yes. But do you get a comfortable bed to rest your head after a long day of sightseeing, a sense of security, and the amenities you need like shampoo, hairdryer and safe? Also yes. 

It's not the Ritz, but if you're a budget traveller who likes having their own room and some decent comforts, then you're set. 

The location is VERY hard to beat too. Within walking distance of the Chrysler Building, Grand Central, Empire State, MetLife, New York Public Library, MoMA, St. Patrick's Cathedral, etc... And other attractions if you don't mind a 30+ minute walk. Excellent restaurants and cafes all around. Felt like a very safe area overall. 

I would come back for sure if I'm ever in the area again!

title: Good single room, on-site facilities poor
text: Room was basic but bed was comfortable and I slept well. Hairdryer in room was useful but safe was broken. On-site faculties were poor - I had no prior warning the on-site restaurant was closed and this is a real issue when I have food allergies. The room service menu was poor and did not accommodate my allergies. Bar only had canned beers and wine. Poor atmosphere but functional.

title: Can't beat this hotel
text: I've stayed at Pod 39 many times. It's clean, basic and great location. You get a small room, that's perfect for sleeping. Everything is well-designed. I especially appreciate that the HVAC system actually works and isn't noisy. I will stay here again, or maybe try Pod 51, but a Pod hotel is definately in the cards.

title: 12 days at Pod39
text:
I've spent 11 nights here based on a friend recommendation and I didn't regret it.
The staff was friendly and helpful, my room was cleaned almost everyday and clean sheets and towels were provided. I'd recommend for solo travellers for sure.
Location is super B, great amenities nearby.

title: Everything I expected!
text: Pod 39 was everything that was advertised - clean, modern, GREAT shower head/water pressure, friendly staff, etc. Of course it was compact, but it's obvious (even from the name) that these are efficient, purpose-built rooms. I loved it and would totally come back!

title: Some rooms smaller than what is described but overall is what you'd expect
text: This is a modern hotel with small rooms where you're not supposed to spend much time in the room itself. The building has a decent bar with pool and ping pong and supposedly a rooftop bar (closed for COVID/winter) but also you're in NYC so no need to hang at your hotel anyway. However, the rooms aren't always consistent. The one I stayed in had an L shaped shower with the longest part being in front of the shower head so you can't stand under it and be in that section. Thus, you have to stand sideways to shower. I checked my friend's room with the same size/layout and it didn't have this issue. I'm guessing it's a support beam, HVAC, etc., but the room wasn't designed around it at all.

title: Cancelamento por alteração de tarifa
text:
Fiz reserva no hotel para o réveillon 2022/2023 e a mesma estava confirmada pelo hotel. Ontem recebi um aviso de cancelamento caso não aceitasse a mudança de tarifa.
Questionei o hotel e o mesmo informou que tiveram um erro no sistema e que a tarifa eles não honrariam, ou eu aceitava o aumento ou cancelariam a reserva e foi o ocorrido.

Estava com a reserva feito a meses, depois que viram a oportunidade de alugar pelo dobro do valor visto o final de pandemia e disponibilidades dos hotéis da região simplesmente não honraram com a tarifa ofertada na reserva. 

Péssima atitude, deveriam ter honrado a tarifa que se propuseram na plataforma oferecer.

title: Clean, Comfortable, All You Need
text: We stayed in a bunk room. We lucked out and got a view of the Empire State Building from our room. The room was clean, comfortable, and honestly all you need for a short stay in the city when you don't plan on being in the room except to sleep. Staff that I encountered were friendly, and if they didn't know the answer, they would find out. 10/10 would stay again. Location if perfect for catching trains, and their is plenty to eat in the neighborhood with out too long of a walk.

title: Hotel moderno recomendable
text: Es una muy buena opción porque está en una zona central, tiene muchos restaurantes/cafés cerca, al igual que la Grand Central, por lo que moverse en transporte público o caminando es fácil. Se puede llegar caminando a Bryant Park, la biblioteca pública, Times Square, Rockefeller, entre otros. El hotel tiene habitaciones muy pequeñas, excesivamente pequeñas pero están nuevas, limpias, y lo justo para lo que se requiere. En el primer piso se puede servir café o té gratis y tiene espacio para comer o trabajar. Es costoso para el tamaño de la habitación pero una alternativa excelente teniendo en cuenta el costo tan alto de Nueva York.

title: Nice stay in a nice hotel
text: Leuk verblijf in pod 39. Had een kamer met stapelbed. Enige nadeel was kwaliteit van bed en ontbreken van een lattenbodem. Voor de rest top hotel, gelegen op een top locatie in midtown.  Eigen badkamer was proper en hoewel het hotel goed gevuld was geen last van andere gasten.

title: midtown location with value
text:
Another repeat visit since location and value.  Even though the room is very small, for even single,
why would need more space being in New York City all day and only late night in your room except
for sleeping!

title: short stay
text: the pod 39 is very convenient to stay at . We didn't mind the bunkbed. A tiny fridge under the deck would be a nice addition. We  were able to walk almost any where in Manhattan with out any issue. Subway and bus also very close. Grand central station just down the way. I would definitely stay there again if traveling to the city.

title: Great experience
text: I traveled with my 16 yr old daughter. We got one of the bunk bed rooms. The beds were very comfortable and the room had everything we needed. It is very tight, but you can’t beat the price. They had free coffee and tea in the lounge area and plenty of leather couches and chairs.

title: NYC Sightseeing
text: Bunk Pod is OK, more spacious than I had thought, hotel real good value. One thing to improve: bathroom glas door should be less transparent. Location is excellent. Staff very friendly and competent. I recommend it.

title: First time in New York
text: It's just a place to sleep,  maybe shower if you're staying longer then 3 days.  Nothing to rave about. Coffee was blah, creamer was gone,  nothing to stir with.  No ice available,  no vending machines,  space in the room barely enough for two suitcases.  Mattress however was comfortable.

title: very good experience
text: to be recommended this is of good value quality and price and location. Staff is also great and available. free coffee and tea is also served  Optimal location in the centre of Manhattan, close to shops and restaurants

title: Amazing staff!`
text: This place was great! I traveled alone and got myself a queen bed room. The staff was great and very helpful and thoughtful. Specially the service lady that was in charge of my floor. Location was the best too!

title: Small, Cozy Room
text: The room was very small and cozy. My view was into someone else’s apt or hotel room and there is no refrigerator. I asked for a higher floor but staff said they did not have any available. The bar services wine and one type of beer and closes at 10pm. The shower was good but it gets the whole entire bathroom floor wet.  I only recommend staying at the hotel if you don’t mind being in a small space with another person.

title: Ubicación,  valor por dinero y servicio
text: Excelente ubicación,  este hotel es una joya valiosa para aquellos que nos gusta viajar a NYC y no tener que gastar tanto.  Tiene un bar cerca el lobby con mesa de bellas y otros plus!!!!  Su personal es super atento.   Las habitaciones limpias y muy cómodas.   De seguro regreso. Ya siento que extraño el hotel.

title: During Covid, a mediocre stay
text:
Great location and price, clean room but just not enough room. It’s like a bathroom that just happened to have a bed in it. No privacy between roommates while using the toilet. Yuck 
The lounge was mostly ok but the flooring was not kept clean. No stirrers for the coffee station and the downstairs bathrooms were not kept clean.

title: Booking through booking.com
text: I just booked a stay through booking.com for later this year. Then I called the hotel to ask about payment methods and Eliza a the front desk was super kind and explained everything to me in details. Can't wait to be there!!

title: GARRY
text:
Another great impromptu staycation with my Bae, Wendy. Table 🏓. Pool table Huge Flat screen TV in lounge.
Charming loung-Empellon al Pastor. Rooms minimalist. We requested extra towels and a blanket from front desk.
Drinksin lounge were inexpensive. 
Centrally located.  We even found parking in front!
Clean

title: Pod fan for life!
text: 4th Pod stay was great as always. The rooms are small, well thought-out, & staff is friendly. Pod 39 has budget-friendly dining options close by and there’s a grocery store around one corner and a bodega on another.

title: Great eastside experience!
text: Great place to stay on the lower east side, between Lexington and Third with frequent buses and Gran Central nearby. Free coffee in the morning and spacious public area, with tables for ping pong and pool, plus much comfy furniture.

title: Awesome stay
text: We had an excellent experience at Pod39. I would recommend it to all my friends. Great location, very modern installation. Friendly staff. Nice small recreation area. Clean rooms. Everything looking brand new.

title: Once upon the time it was great, not any more
text: I have stayed several times years ago, this time 2022 i found the hotel going down the hill. The rooms are not that clean despite the efforts of the housekeepers, I understand wear and tear but the property haven't had a good maintenance to keep it shape.

title: Cool but wtf the alarm at 10 to 12
text: Nothing to say, the rooms are good for 2 people, the bathroom size is ok, but i don’t understand why, right now, are somebody playing or testing an alarm, I CAN’T SLEEP why are u doing this in the morning, you have all the afternoon

title: Comfy & affordable stay!
text: This was the perfect stay. Everything from the price to the quiet comfy room, it was everything I needed for my short get away. The room even had a desk for me to get work done and a small safe to store my tablet and other small valuables worry free. I look forward to my next stay. Thank you!

title: Very Nice Option
text: Muy buen hotel. En excelente ubicación a un costo accesible. Buen servicio de limpieza. Servicio amable. Los dormitorios son simples, no tienen frigobar. Los baños tienen mamparas templadas semi transparentes. Eso puede ser un poco incómodo para algunos.

title: Cozy and clean room in the heart of Manhattan
text: Despite de size of the rooms, they are very clean, well arnessed, taking advantage of every hole, clenaing service every day, very comfortable bed, air conditioned, the shower worked powerful and perfectly, soap, good towels, hair dryer... Small rooms but well equiped. Hall and lobby bar very nice, with courtesy coffee every morning. Very very close to heart of Manhattan, Chrysler, Grand Central, Bryant Park...Highly recommendable!!

title: Great Location No Frills Accommodation
text:
Great location. Hotel was safe/secure. Rooms are basic and compact but very clean with good WiFi and a decent bed. Ensuite bathroom with a good shower and complimentary soap, shampoo and conditioner. 
Pretty much all you need if you plan to spend the majority of your time out in the city.

title: Small but perfectly formed
text: I had a great nights sleep. Bed was comfortable and room was very clean.  Small rooms but great use of space so this is not a problem. En-suite generous in size with everything you need. Didn’t know what to expect but I’m totally impressed. Price was also good. Throughly recommend

title: Perfect for a weekend getaway!
text: Pod39 is the perfect place to stay if you’re looking for a less expensive but still high quality hotel in the city. If you’re expecting more than just the basics, look else where. Pod39 truly has just what you need. We stayed in a room with a Queen bed and it had enough room for the bed, two end tables, a small desk and chair, a TV on the wall, and a full bathroom. Exactly what you need for one night in the city. Another great thing about Pod39 is the staff. Every staff interaction we had was pleasant and made us feel welcome. I would absolutely recommend Pod39 to a friend or even stay here again the next time I’m in the city!

title: Our go-to NYC hotel
text: We love Pod hotels — always clean, well-maintained, friendly, and stylish, with a hip vibe and international clientele. Rooms are small but we are out all day while in the city. Excellent value overall, highly recommend!

title: Location, staff, cleanliness, perfect.
text: The room was clean and cozy, the prices were nice, and the staff were friendly and helpful. I accidentally locked myself out and they helped me through it very quickly. The room service lady were nice. And most of all, the location is perfect! Located a bit to the east of the center downtown, it is much quieter but still close to everything. Everywhere is a couple minutes walk away.

title: Overnight stay
text: The Pod 39 is my go-to hotel for overnight stays, especially if I arrive in NYC late from the airport or working late in the city and miss my train home. Clean rooms and friendly staff to greet you on arrival.

title: Vacation
text: Didn't return security deposit, pod 39, 145 east 39st, be careful and don't pay by cash , we were in September and they didn't do anything, i called , send messages , and no effect . Didn't change towels, didn't clean rooms without any warnings.  Location is good, that's all

title: Más de lo esperado!
text: Nos encantó este hotel. Si bien la habitación era muy pequeña, es uno de los hoteles mas limpios en los que me he hospedado en Manhattan. Tenía todo. La cama super confortable, toallas impecables y la ducha lo mejor de todo. Muy buena la atención de su personal. Cuenta con un area en común para poder desayunar, almorzar o cenar, lo que nos permitía ahorrar dinero. Por las mañanas hay café y té de cortesía. La zona muy buena, a 250 metros de la Gran Terminal, a pasos del Bryant Park. A menos de 200 metros hay un market abierto las 24 hs. Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Pésimo hotel en NY
text:
La entrada parece divertida , todo cambia cuando la atención de una d esas chicas de recepción es fatal , malhumorada y grosera ella es delgada y usa lentes , su compañera parece más amable. 
Las habitaciones son frías , lúgubres , cierto decorado es lindo pero el concepto es muy desagradable , cabeceras y camas frente a la puerta del baño (iuuugh) 
El área de billar está descuidada , las mesas sucias , botes de basura llenos .
Se escucha el ruido del elevador a cada momento que lo ocupan.
Fingen no hablar español.

title: Simple, clean, efficient weekend stay
text: The room was everything it needed to be. Clean, nice bed, good water pressure in the shower. We even got an upgrade and were able to check in early! Made our stay much more comfortable than expected!!

title: Pod 39 is very disappointing
text: We all know that NYC rooms are small but these rooms take the cake—room enough for one person to sit. For some reason the metal doors were dirty throughout the hotel. The staff was unhelpful. In the lobby, you can see a bunch of junk piled up in the room next door. The only positive was the shower, which was surprisingly nice. Good for international teens and 20 somethings on a shoestring budget, but recommend everyone else spring for a less tiny place to stay.

title: Pod 39 Hotel
text: Excellent hotel! Super clean and safe. The staff is very kind and helpful.  Andrew (manager) went out of his way multiple times to make sure that I enjoyed my stay and had everything that I needed. I will definitely be back the next time I’m in New York!

title: Worst Customer Service I’ve ever had
text:
I was supposed to go to NY in March and because of COVID 19 I wasn’t able to go.

Since that, I’ve had the absolute worst experience with your customer service. I was promised a refund, then after 3 months Pod’s team said it was not possible. I’ve been waiting for at least a voucher to use in 2021 and since then no one from your customer service haven’t even contacted me.

title: Would give negative star if I could
text: Was looking to take a romantic getaway in NYC with my boyfriend. Booked a room, received confirmation, traveled, showed up the day of and it turned out the hotel was closed to public due to COVID. Upon speaking to the manager, he was extremely rude, accusatory, and unapologetic when we explained to him the situation. His direct words were “you booked through a third party therefore it’s not my problem.” They then told us to leave, then we had to call the third party and find a new hotel myself. I would not book a room there again even if they paid me to.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE!
text: Hotel bankrupt, they have not refunded a stay THEY CANCELLED ( c. $1000) to my mother who was visiting me from Ireland. Your booking will be cancelled and they will keep your money. Only reason given is they are not in a position to reimburse us right now. They say this yet they are still operating and taking guests. Refund people hard earned money or SHUT DOWN AND GO INTO RECEIVERSHIP.

title: Vibrant place in the heart of NYC
text:
Of course, your room would be small. Of course, the price would be above average. But it's a great deal for NYC. And when you choose to live right in the Downtown, you realize that it's a normal size for you room, and the price is very reasonable.
I enjoyed our stay very much. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is young and vibrant. On the first day, they offered us to leave our bags for a couple of hours, so they can check us in in a better room.
The room is clean. And despite the size (which is not too small but just small), it was very cozy. I was even able to do my morning stretching. Maybe, our window was too close to the bed, but for the warm month of October it was just fine. Speaking of window, it was as if we almost didn't have any view at all, but again, you pay for a proper room in the heart of NY.
Everything worked smoothly: bathroom facilities, TV. Nothing disturbed our sleep. 
Location is perfect if you want to live in a middle of everything - easily get to both Upper Manhattan, and to Lower Manhattan, and if you don't have your favorite neighborhood where you really want to spend all the time, like SoHo, or the Village. I would say that one is ideal for people who want to see all of the city and are not ready to spend a fortune for their stay in NYC. Highly recommended.

title: super
text:
hotel genial 
ambiance jeune tarifs attractif
salle de bains dans la chambre chose rare pour ce prix 
a 7 min de marche de la gare central
20 min a pieds de times square !!!
amazing j y reviendrai
et roof top de compet pour l apero
personnel agrable parlant meme francais et tres serviable merci a toute l equipe

title: Not a recent visit
text: NOTE: My visit was in July several years ago.   I'd return as I loved this place and its location. Rooms are like IKEA model apartments.  Decor young and relaxed.  Full of foreign adventurers young and older like me.  Reasonable small breakfast.  Found hair salon and a chinese - Sichuan, I think - restaurant nearby.  Easy access to subway for visits to my son in Brooklyn and reasonable transport to Newark Airport (and probably others.)

title: Terrible customer service
text: Our reservation was cancelled by Pod.  However it takes months to get a refund for a cancellation that was not our doing. Sorry that NYC is having such a rough time, but it doesn’t give you the right to keep our money for 3 months and not process a refund quickly. Everyone is hurting these days!

title: A really neat minimalist room to stay in the Big Apple
text: Room was minimalist, quite comfortable, quiet, neat shower. You need your room card key to get the elevator to your floor. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was amazing how much they fit in the small room. You had everything you needed, tv, shower, sink, toilet, our room had windows looking out. Compared to the big hotels, it was very reasonable. You can walk there from Grand Central Station, or the bus from the airport. I know we will stay there, next time we get called to the city.

title: Okay budget choice in Manhattan
text: It is one of the most famous budget choice in Manhattan. The room is small and not very clean. Location is good, 10 mins to metro station and the 5th Avenue. There are lots of mid-range restaurants nearby. Airpot bus terminal is just in 5 mins walk. Overall it's value for money.i

title: Great place to crash and relax
text:
I was in NYC for just one night. The room was perfect for the solo traveler to rest and recover. The shower had all of the toiletries needed to freshen up. The bed was comfortable. The climate controls were simple to adjust. 

Add walking distance to Grand Central Terminal and a central location to the city, it’s a great place to stay in the city.

title: Value for money at a great location
text: Stayed here for 6 nights in my recent NYC business trip. The room was smaller than I was expecting, but rest of the facilities were great. Especially the location is best. You can go literally to everywhere in mid Manhattan by walk. For subway you have Grand Central three streets away. Bed was comfortable, bathroom with hot shower was great. Complimentary coffee was available after 7:00 am in the morning. The staffs including reception staffs were great. They even get my room ready for time. Highly recommended for people in tight budget for prohibitory expensive NYC trip.

title: Value rooms but lacking elsewhere
text: On the positive side, the decor was funky and the main lounge area comfortable with a good atmosphere and various games to play. Service varied from highly positive and welcoming to sullen and disinterested. The no frills rooms were clean and functional - perfect for sleeping and freshening up but an extra cover or blanket would have been useful.The glass doored shower rooms, whilst understandable for extra light, did not provide the privacy I would have liked!Very noisy air conditioning kept us awake first night but we turned it off overnight for the rest of our stay. Food was a little expensive but tasty, (ate mostly at Scotty's Diner on the corner - great value and food!) on the whole the location was great - easy walk from Empire state, Grand Central, The Rock, Times Square etc and reasonably priced.

title: Great NY vibe
text: Perfect location and great vibe for a small hotel. Nice rooftop bar. Slow elevators. Small rooms but comfortable. Close to everything. Very good for business trips or Romantic couples looking to enjoy the city.

title: Solides Hotel, sehr gute Lage aber mit vielen Einschränkungen
text:
Ich habe eine Woche in diesem Hotel verbracht für einen New York Aufenthalt. Die Lage ist klasse und ich habe das Hotel sofort gefunden.

Der Check-In lief leider nicht so gut. Die Rezeptionistin konnte meine Buchung nicht finden, forderte mich auf die Expedia Bestätigung vorzuzeigen, die reichte dann nicht es musste dann noch eine andere sein und tat so, als sei dies alles meines Schuld. Dann wirkte sie so, als müsste sie jetzt jemanden anrufen und ich wahrscheinlich eine Nacht auf der Straße schlafen. Bis ihr Kollege fragte was los sei, auf einen Blick die Buchung fand und sie dann schroff sagte ok, jetzt noch die Gebühren. 
Weder eine Entschuldigung für die Verzögerung, noch eine Erklärung wie alles im Hotel funktioniert. Das erfragte ich mir am nächsten Tag bei einem Kollegen. 

Die Zimmer sind klasse designed und eingerichtet. Obwohl sie klein sind, reicht der Platz gut aus und das Badezimmer und besonders die Dusche sind sehr groß. Der Bereich ist mit einer Glaswand abgetrennt, was hilft dass das Zimmer trotz der geringen große geräumig erscheint. Ich habe mich wohlgefühlt. Das einzige was gestört hat war, dass ca. alle 30 Minuten ein lautes Brummen startete und einige Minuten blieb. Dies war nicht die Klimaanlage denn die lief natürlich auch, was mich aber nicht gestört hat.

Das Zimmerpersonal hat immer gründlich sauber gemacht und war sehr sehr freundlich.

Beim Check-Out wurde mir dann noch ein Transfer vermittelt, was mir meine Abreise sehr erleichterte.

Ich kann durchaus empfehlen in diesem Hotel zu schlafen, es hat alles was man braucht, ist modern und nett eingerichtet. Jedoch hatte ich eben nicht nur positive Erfahrungen sondern vor allem der Geräuschpegel von einem Gerät (welches weiß ich nicht) und das Personal an der Rezeption waren nicht so gut. 
Positiv sind aber der Preis, die Lage, Einrichtung und die Sauberkeit.

title: Goede ligging
text: Mini kamer, zo klein dat je net in bed kunt stappen, prima bed,, goede ligging, overal dichtbij, slecht ontbijt in het hotel. Beter om de hoek gaan ontbijten. Prima bar, lekkere cocktails en hapjes en leuke ambiance.

title: 3 days
text: Great location.. clean .. no frills... pet friendly and offer specials that are to good to run down. It’s small but most of the time I’m busy so I don’t send much time in the room except to sleep and shower. I’ll keep going back.

title: 便利な場所にあり観光には良い
text: ホテルの近くにはお店がいろいろあって便利です。ミッドタウン内の便利な所にあるので地下鉄の利用は良かったが、お部屋はあまりきれいではないです。又シングルベッドでお部屋は狭いです。

title: 便利で良かった
text:
部屋は皆さんの投稿通り日本のビジネスホテル位です。
しかし朝は1階の朝食コーナーで９時迄何杯でもコーヒー無料、15階のウォーターサーバーも無料。
グランドセントラル駅に近くどこに行くにも便利でした。

title: Has everything you need
text:
We stayed as a couple at Pod 39 in December 2019 in a mini bunk pod room. 

The room was basic and very small but had everything we needed and was modern and very clean. And obviously, visiting New York we never planned to spend a lot of time in the room! 

The bunk beds were actually comfy had no issue sleeping. The only thing we did notice was the heating in the room, if turned on would get overly warm quite quickly, probably due to the room sizes being so small but this was easily fixed by turning the heating off. 

The hotel itself was very clean and modern, the bar downstairs was great with friendly bar staff and the location of the hotel was perfect (very close to grand central and roughly 15-20 min walk to Times Square). 

Overall, enjoyed our stay here and did exactly what it said on the tin! For the price too we was pleasantly surprised and found it to be perfect for our needs. 

Would recommend and would stay again if returning to NY.

title: Excelente.
text: Perfecta elección! Bien ubicado, limpio, cómodo y calentito. No necesitas nada más. Por la mañana hasta las 9 te dan café gratis para tomar ahí o llevártelo! Las camas son muy cómodas, la ducha increíble!!!! No lo dudes! Es el hotel ideal! Nosotros contratamos sin querer camas cuchetas, pero la verdad, nada que objetar, súper cómodas! Algo distinto jaja

title: A poor experience...and terrible customer service
text:
The actual hotel where I stayed in December 2019 is not awful. The rooms are a little spartan. The promised breakfast- downstairs- was really joy some croissants and an apple. And not really ready at 08.15. But worst of all was my checking out  experience. I paid for my room twice by mistake and instantly spotted they had double charged. The receptionist immediately apologised and promised to refund d my card immediately explaining it took 2 weeks for it to appear on my statement. SEVEN weeks later after numerous emails, and me sending credit card bills, and the reception *claiming* it had been done, and me asking for the GM's email I finally got confirmation it was credited. So:
1. poor poor service OR
2. something more challenging
I would never stay there again. And would urge other traveller to be careful about charges

title: Compacto e eficiente
text:
O ponto forte do hotel é a sua localização (facil p/ subir e descer Manhattan e ir p/ o Brooklyn também). Perto do metrô, fora da muvuca de Times Square, com várias opções de restaurantes por perto e staff bastante solícito.
Os quartos são compactos e funcionais. Cama confortável, tudo novo e com serviço de limpeza bem eficiente (oq não é fácil de achar em NY). 
Foi o menor quarto de hotel que já me hospedei, mas atendeu perfeitamente às minhas necessidades. Porém, se você viaja com muita bagagem, vai ficar apertado.
O público é jovem, a decoração do hotel idem, o bar do térreo costuma lotar na happy hour e o rooftop estava fechado para reforma nos dias que estive lá.
Achei um ótimo custo benefício e me hospedaria lá novamente!

title: Simple but just what you need in NYC
text: The room was exactly as described with a queen bed, a small desk, and a bathroom with a shower stall. The room was small but that was expected given that it is a pod. The room was clean and the hotel was quiet. All the staff was very pleasant. I would definitely stay there again. Great value for the price.

title: Good things in small packages
text: I recently traveled to NYC for a class.  As a grad student with a family of 4 money is ridiculously tight.  So I didn't want to spend a lot on a hotel, I just wanted to stay somewhere clean and safe since I was a female traveling alone.  I booked the hotel for 5-nights, 2 for sightseeing, and then the rest for the class.  I paid the extra for a double-bed with a private bath.  The hotel and the room were spotless.  Each and every employee that I interacted with were polite, helpful, friendly, and welcoming.  The hotel is centrally located.  Grand Central Terminal (Station) was about a block away, which was handy for buying a little bit of cheese, meat, and fruit for enjoying in my room.  There are no microwaves, refrigerators, or coffee pots.  While I would have preferred to have one of each, I was happy to not have to pay the extra for those little conviences.  The heater/air conditioner did a spectacular job!  And it was nice to have windows on 2 of the walls.  I think the space is perfect for one person.  Maybe 2 people if they are young and tiny.  But I would not stay there with my husband as we are both middle-aged adults with a little extra on our middles.  And between our little bit of extra pudge and the extra creaks in our joints, I just don't think we'd sleep comfortably here, but it was perfect for just me.  :)  I would totally recommend and if I have the need to stay in Manhatten again, I won't hesitate to book a pod.

title: Fulfills Basic Needs at a Basic Price
text: One of my traveling companions stayed here before and I can see why she is repeat customer. We were out and about all day every day so just needed a place to crash at night. Pod is tiny but clean. The staff is friendly and helpful...especially Joel who serves up fresh pastries and complimentary coffee in the lounge every morning. Pod is on a quiet side street just a few blocks from Grand Central Station, which offers a shuttle to Times Square. Would definitely stay here again.

title: mutlaka gıdılmelı
text: kesınlıkle cok begendıgım fıyat performans otelı. merkeze uzaklıgı yerınde, temızlık ve hızmetde basarılıydı. bız memnun kaldık, ev tutmakla burası arasında kalmıstık ama otelın rahatlıgı baska oluyor

title: One Night to Sleep!
text:
The accommodation was great, if you’re looking for a place to stay for the night and stay in the city, this is definitely a bang for your buck.

One room, one bunk, sleeps two people! Definitely great destination for back packers and adventurers. 

Don’t expect a full on resort.

There are towels and shower accessories in our particular stay. Very clean.

title: Size doesn’t matter
text: If you’re traveling alone on a budget and want to see some midtown sights, I can’t imagine anywhere better to stay. Though very small, the room is well-appointed & quite comfortable, and the service is excellent. I used both A/C and heater and both worked well. The bed was very comfortable and I fell asleep quickly. The location is obviously fantastic, yet the price is substantially lower than what you would pay at most chain hotels in the area. The in-hotel restaurant, Empellon al Pastor, is quite tasty and reasonable in price. My only complaint was the quality of breakfast offerings, which were just bagels and muffins (no go for those on keto) but there’s a solid diner less than a block from the hotel that sufficed. I will definitely be staying here again the next time I’m in NYC and highly recommend it.

title: Funcional, mas sem conforto
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado e limpo, porém o quarto é minúsculo. Mal cabe uma mala dentro e o banheiro é literalmente COLADO com a cama. O hotel possui um bar legal embaixo com vários happy hours e um rooftop beem legal para hóspedes e visitantes. O único problema é realmente o tamanho do quarto que deixa a desejar muito.

title: Lugar prático
text: Muito bem localizado, o pod tem quartos pequenos mas que atendem bem a sua função: dormir e tomar banho! Clima jovem e decoração atual além de um ótimo atendimento aos hóspedes! Recomendo e com certeza voltaria a me hospedar aqui!

title: The room and location worth the price
text: The room hotel for single bed is totally decent for one person plus luggage. Room is also clean. Location is very strategic, in Midtown area. Closed to everywhere (Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Koreatown, etc), that I forgot to take a subway. Will definitely recommend this place to others.

title: Comodo e pulito
text: La posizione del pod 39 è molto comoda, poco distante dalla grand central station e dalla 5th avenue. Le camere sono molto piccole, come ben spiegato anche dal sito, ma divise in maniera veramente efficace, in modo che, anche se in solo 11 mq ci stia il letto matrimoniale, un piccolo tavolino, un attacapanni e un bagno abbanstanza spazioso. Inoltre è molto curata anche la pulizia.

title: Solo stay over the Christmas season
text:
I stayed between 26th Dec 2019 and 1st Jan 2020 and looking at those dates, I was relieved that how much I paid in total equalled how much some NY hotels were charging for just one night. It was definitely budget friendly and I certainly felt it was value for money. 
Some people are commenting on the size of room. Personally as a solo traveller I felt it was all I needed and it was actually bigger than I anticipated! Perfect for when you are just needing somewhere to rest your head at night. My room was always kept nice and clean by the housekeeping team and I experienced no noise problems whether indoors from other rooms or from outdoors. The only noise issue was the sound of the heater which was quite loud and I did not keep on for too long as I was concerned it may be annoying others. However, the heater itself functioned so that made me happy and I had no air-con issues like I have sometimes experienced elsewhere!
In terms of the location of the hotel, I could not have asked for more with a CVS and chains like Starbucks, Chipotle and Pret in the immediate area (not including the food court at Grand Central). Minutes from Grand Central which opened the rest of Manhattan and the other boroughs up to you by subway. Also walking distance from major attractions such as the Public Library, Bryant Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller.
Overall as a solo female traveller I felt very safe and secure both in the hotel and walking around the surrounding area. I did not speak to the hotel team often but when I did on checking in and out, they were always very helpful. Only slight surprise was a $30 security deposit each day which would be returned at the end of the stay but the hotel was open about that when checking in and it would certainly not stop me staying there again. So happy I chose to stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend. Modern, clean, budget friendly and with a great location.

title: Bra läge
text: Trevligt hotell med nära avstånd till många sevärdigheter. Rent och snyggt. Väldigt litet och trångt rum. Lyhört från korridor samt att ventilationen störde. Skjutdörr av frostat glas till toaletten vilket kanske inte passar alla. Trots allt övervägde det centrala läget.

title: Repetiría
text: Por ubicación, calidad y precio volvería sin duda. Tiene un par de 24h cercanos, restaurantes de todo tipo, Grand Central a 3 minutos y algunos de los principales lugares de interés a 15 minutos andando. Volvería sin duda.

title: Bliss!
text: I booked Pod 39 accommodation through a travel promotion for my husband and I, and was hopeful that it would be ok. Well, it exceeded our expectations. Pod 39 is welcoming, vibrant and exceptionally clean. As it would suggest, the rooms are snug, however, after a long day sightseeing, we welcomed the bunk beds and our own TV each (too perfect). There are plenty of eating options close by if you don't feel like venturing too far. We Love, Love Love Pod 39 and will definitely be back.

title: Mr Nikybee
text: Very cozy and clean little spot Great service and friendly staff. Parking was a bit difficult at times but overall it was fine. I enjoyed the ammeneties as well. I had a fantastic stay and I will be returning soon.

title: Overpriced, micro rooms
text: Fantastic location close to Grand Central. The room was even smaller than I expected, and the bed had no headboard, so the pillows kept falling onto the floor. The heater is very loud in that tiny room so it was hard to sleep. And what is with the 25 dollar a night "resort fee" that gets tacked onto the price? Why not just be honest about what the price of the room is?

title: Just bearable
