text: This was my first time in a pod as a frequent traveller. I've been to many budget hotels in NA and this is probably the second worst one (loud hvac fan). I stayed in a single pod and it is quite small for a petite lady. If you are larger it is advisable that you upgrade to a queen pod. If you are a couple and want to have a comfortable bed to sleep in, (despite the room saying it will fit two people) book a bunk bed room instead, and maybe spend extra to skip this place. If you are sensitive to sound, look elsewhere. Forget this place!!! There is a fan in the bathroom that is incredibly loud, and you cannot turn it off because you would suffocate in such a tiny room (how does no one mention this???). It took me 2 nights to get used to the sound, and it was not a pleasant experience!!! It took me forever to sleep during the first night, and I was woken up again by the noise. I would have chosen somewhere else had I known the noise level. Cheap bedding, cheap toilet paper, I've had better at other budget hotels. The room is also *not* soundproof, despite advertised as. I have been woken up many times in the morning by people knocking, talking, and have heard people walk in and out. Depending when you shower, the water is not always warm. On Thursday I showered around 11PM, and the water was barely warm. If you are staying here, I advise you to shower early, at 8 - 9PM or else deal with poor pressure and lukewarm...even cold water. Room service and cleanliness is *very* good. My room is pristine when I return in the evening. Cleaning staff is very nice. The location is great, steps away from the metro and lots of places to eat at within a 5 minute walk. Anyway...not really a hotel experience, but more like an expensive hostel. Hope I get my deposit back haha. PS: I rather pay extra for printing and tours I never used than get charged extra. Wish there was a kettle in the room - there is always a kettle in hotels I've stayed at.

title: Good location and has all you need for a short stay in NY
text:
As everyone says these rooms are small - hence the name pod, but they are functional, clean and rather quiet (which is very high on my list for a good hotel). The location is excellent - just around the corner from Central station and in a safe neighbourhood so you feel comfortable walking around at night.
Given the small size of the rooms - I stayed in a queen so I think this is one of their biggest rooms - I recommend only sharing a room if it is with someone you know well - i.e. no privacy.
Good shower pressure, however take a shower cap if you don't want to wash you hair every time you shower as its one of those shower heads that gushes out from above only.
Would highly recommend to anyone wanting small, functional, centrally located place to stay on a trip to NY.

title: Perfect for solo travelers
text: I spent 2 nights here in a queen room. The location is fantastic - close to Grand Central station, subway, and walk-able to many things. The room was exactly what I expected - small and basic, but comfortable, clean and very, very quiet. It fit my needs exactly. However I would be very reluctant to recommend this hotel to non-solo travelers for one reason: the bathroom walls and door are glass, and while they are frosted in the middle they are still quite see-through. The toilet and shower are just.. right there. It could make things awkward if you are traveling with someone you aren't very close to. If you're traveling alone and just want a cheap (by New York City standards) place to sleep this is a great choice.

title: Very nice and helpful staff makes budget hotel bearable
text: Main take-away from this experience was the very nice and helpful staff. All those working on the front desk can give themselves a pat on the back. The hotel is adequate for short stays of 1-2 nights. Apart from that, the Pod39 has major down sides. It's a bit like a prison, and the windows of my room (Floor 2) opened on to a dark, dingy, unsafe looking shaft between buildings. It was impossible to tell the time of day.

title: Budget hotel
text: I found the room clean and comfortable but it is very very small. We had a double pod. Reminded me of a uni room/bedsit Bathroom is a glass screen sliding between you on the toilet or in the shower. Ample sockets and usb charger. Shower was good. Hairdryer ready to use and shower gel, Shampoo and conditioner. Comfy bed but the window is so draughty & cold. Outlook was like being in prison. You get what you pay for! Fairly close to the tube & everything is an easy walk away

title: Room across from elevator
text: If you get stuck in the room across from the elevator, expect to be awoken all night long by the sound od people coming off the elevator. I have 3 more nights here and the front desk won't  confirm they will move...maybe is what they aay.  with people checking out every day, i am stuck in the worst room (on every floor)...so thats what you get at a pod hotel, beware.

title: Buen hotel
text: Buen hotel para descansar , habitaciones pequeñas pero limpias y caliente , toallas limpias todos los días , te guardan las maletas el último día si te hace falta, cerca de la biblioteca y al lado de la gran central y edificio Chrysler, repetiría.

title: Deposit not paid back
text:
My husband and I travelled from the UK to stay in your Pod 39 hotel in New York for three nights in September - from the 12-15. We had a great stay and enjoyed the hotel a great deal.

Therefore we are hugely disappointed that despite a number of emails to the hotel in question we still have not had our deposit paid back to us. We are still, nearly three months on awaiting for our $90 to be refunded.

title: Nice and convenient
text: Comfortable bed, clean and neat, and great shower. That’s all I needed and the price was right. The multiple elevators were prompt and the lobby bar was inviting. And the location was convenient to a variety of attractions. I used the money I saved to get upgraded show tickets and dinners. Just what I wanted. My view of the Empire State Building was a bonus.

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed for four nights last month and it was probably one of the best located hotels for the times we have stayed in New York. Very good price and we stayed on the 17th floor in a Queen Room. Initially concerned that noise may be an issue due to bar/roof-top area but no noise whatsoever.

title: В NY на неделю
text:
Итак, настала моя очередь написать про POD 39. Проживал 6 дней в ноябре 2019. Добирался на трэйне (от станции Howard Beach до 42ST, минут 40 - синяя ветка А). Далее по 42 улице практически по прямой 20 минут пешком (вам нужен любой трейн ветки В, который идет в downtown) - после 50 ST идет раздвоение ветки, но вас это волновать не должно т.к. вам выходить раньше). 
Заселение строго с 15ч (у меня и всех кто заселялся со мной в тот же день). Часок провел в баре прям напротив зоны ресепшен (никуда выходить не нужно). Удобно.. пиво  лагер, я даже не уточнял название, по 7$ + чай; олдфэшн за 12$ - узнал чуть позже:)
Депозит есть - какой так и не понял, из-за того что были еще и налоги. Надеюсь что-то вернется (платил картой).
Итак номер: Маленький - миниатюрный. У меня был номер со своей ванной и туалетом. Кровать двухместная, но не кингсайз. В двоем может быть тестно, но для одного самое то. Фен, шампунь, гель для душа , кондиционер - все есть и нормального качества. Полотенца два комплекта по три штуки (я заселялся один) - меняли каждый день. Сейф есть. Кондиционер есть и не сильно шумит. ТВ был, маленький, каналы хз , я его не включал. Вешелок 7-8. Шкафа нет. Что касается "уединения" - если вы молодая пара и у вас конфетно-букетный, то могут быть сложности (дверца есть, но прозрачная). Если же Вы уже много лет вместе и понимаете , что в организме человека бабочек не существует, то норм. В конце концов можно попросить любимого человека выйти в бар. 
ВАЖНО! Веранда в ноябре не работает. Тупо закрыта. Грустно, т.к. из-за нее и бронил 39й; А в ноябре были еще теплые денечки. Были и другие варианты и от этой же сетки (таймсквер и 51й). Честно сказать, думал что терраса будет раьотать. Но ничего, в центре NY много руфтопов. Пешком, до таймсквер реально 15-20 минут. Рядом крайслер, цетральный вокзал и библиотека (найдите время, зайдите - поднимайтесь сразу на последний этаж:)) 
Самый большой плюс: Чистота! На 4* точно. Очень приятно. Убирают каждый день и отлично. Без пафоса и лирики типо "мне есть с чем сравнивать" - я был доволен. Вернусь ли сюда, наверно да, но лучше в LA:)

Путешествуйте.

title: Ubicación y limpieza de 10
text:
Habitaciones pequeñas pero si te sabes gestionar de sobra, es lo que tiene Nueva York. La ubicación es perfecta está en el medio de todo y caminando de hace todo genial. 
A destacar las camadas súper cómodas, limpieza y el trato. Sobre todo Steve, quien aconseja a todo que rutas tomar y planes que hacer.
Volveremos.

title: Brilliant hotel
text: I stayed in Pod 39 as a solo traveler last week for 4 nights and loved the hotel.  Yes the rooms are small, but this is the whole concept of the hotel, anyone who complains about the room sizes clearly didn’t do any research and therefore has no grounds to moan.  I stayed in a Queen pod and the room was perfect for what I needed it for – somewhere to get my head down after a busy day of sightseeing.  There were about 6 coat hangers and 2 hooks on the wall for coats, plenty of clean towels every day and the shampoo, conditioner and shower gel provided was lovely.  My room was on the 12th floor and I never heard any noise at all.  There was a bar just off the lobby and on the roof, I didn’t make it in for a drink but they looked pretty lively.  The location of the hotel was great too, a few streets away from Grand Central  and the subway line and about a 10 minute walk from Times Square.  The staff reception and at the concierge desk were also very friendly and helpful.  If I return to New York I will definitely stay here again.

title: Good Stay BUT NOT DEPOSIT REFUND
text: I've stayed at Pod 39 three weeks ago, and it was fine. Good location, tiny but comfortable rooms. The only problem I have (still have) is that they made a charge on my debit cart as a deposit. After check out the concierge told me that in a . couple o days the refund would be made. It's been 3 weeks, and severals mails to the hotel, and no one answering.

title: Have stayed here more than once
text:
I have stayed at most of the NY POD hotels and am a fan of the overall concept. I like this one for the location (close to Penn and Grand Central, near great Murray Hill restaurants, near subway). The rooms vary in size. My room on my most recent stay was tiny, but since I really just slept there, I didn't mind. There wasn't much street noise, but there was something going on with the HVAC in the space next to my room. 
The bar scene was lively and the roof deck seemed a very popular destination with 20-somethings.

title: Très bien
text:
Lorsqu'on réserve un Hôtel à NY on ce demande toujours sur quoi nous allons tomber.
Ici nous avons été agréablement surpris, la chambre est très petites mais nous le savions, la clim fût bien pratique vu les grosses chaleurs et surtout une chambre dans un état irréprochable ! 
Le rooftop est très bien, cher, mes bien ! Ambiance Lounge et jeune.
Parfaitement situé.
Nous garderons un très bon souvenir.

title: Great Choice!
text:
This is a great location in close proximity to all mid-towne points of interest. Everyone of the staff that I encountered was friendly and highly responsive. The rooms were clean and the layout was practical. 
Great Choice!!!

title: Service
text:
Ambiance of the hotel was great! 
Service I experienced during my stay here was very good. 
I did not manage to get his name but I would like to thank the guy who was at the reception desk at 5.30 - 5.45 pm,16th November 2019 for his excellent service. 

Location was also walking distance from many amenities and attractions. 
Will definitely return.

title: Zentraler Ausgangspunkt!
text: Das Hotel liegt zentral in Manhatten nahe der Grand Central Station. Es war für mich der perfekte Ausgangspunkt für Spaziergänge, Sightseeing und Shopping. Es gibt viele Cafés und Restaurants sowie Supermärkte in der Nähe.

title: small but nice
text: it has small rooms but very well equipped. the location is great and staff are very friendly. the terrace is very nice. when you book reminder to get the rooms with private bathrooms otherwise you have to share

title: Great value stay in the heart of Manhattan
text: Very clean and comfortable (if a little small) rooms, fantastically friendly staff and awesome location just 3 blocks from Grand Central Station. Easy to get just about everywhere in NYC from here, and a bunch of good restaurants nearby (be sure to check out the Urbanspace Vanderbilt food hall at Grand Central). Would definitely seat again!

title: Pod39
text: Fair price, good location, clean room. Excellent for those who enjoy traveling without focusing on comfort. Well located, just a few blocks from Grand Central and tourist spots. Quiet room, good insulation.

title: Small, cozy and functional
text: Pod39 has an excellent cost x benefit in NYC.  Despite the small size of the rooms (be prepared and don't come with a lot of bags), they are comfortable, modern and functional.  The shower is great!  The hotel charges a resort fee that sounds strange for me.  Even than, it worths the price.

title: Disappointed with charges
text:
My wife and I had a one night stop in NYC and decided to try this hotel. The hotel is very inviting and modern. The staff was courteous and helpful.  The rooms are quite small but provided needed accommodation. The rooms were also very clean. 
The only negative for this hotel is that there were extra charges other than the expected charge for the room. There was a $30 deposit for non smoking. There was also a charge of $77 that was supposedly a mistake. It has been a week since our stay and I have not yet seen a refund. I have written to the hotel with no reply. 
I would really like to give a better review, however these extra costs prohibit so. 
I read other reviews indicating problems with extra charges.

title: Perfect setup for a good price
text: I stayed one night in a single pod and it was perfect for my needs. Compact space but with multiple storage options, a desk and good wifi, a well organised bathroom area with plentiful hot water. Great value for NYC and easy walking to subway, lots of food options and NY sights. Checkin and checkout were easy. I would definitely stay again.

title: Functional and comfortable
text: Having stayed at Pod 39 previously the great service, price and location had me returning again. I booked a single pod which was, as advertised, small but incredibly functional, with every nook and cranny designed to be of use. It never felt cramped! I also had full use of the roof when I needed to stretch out (in NYC to run the marathon and the rooftop space was great for warmups and prep). Everyone was delightfully friendly and it’s only a short walk to Grand Central station where getting around on the subway is a breeze from there. The bar and restaurant was delicious and have great deals. Couldn’t not stay again if I returned to the city - thanks all!

title: Excellent Value
text:
I stayed at the Pod 39 hotel for two nights for a business trip. My flight got in at 6am but knew my check in time wasn’t until 3pm. When I arrived, they were able to store my luggage so i didn’t have to lug
my stuff around and was able to explore the city. 

The lobby is really trendy with a restaurant and a bar. They also had cool spaces to hang out. 

When I got to my room I was shocked by how small it was with essentially just a twin bed and bathroom. But, as I settled in, I found it was the perfect amount of space for a single traveler. The room was really clean and trendy, which was a big plus. The bed was just the right size for me and actually really confortable. There was also the ability to change the thermostat for the room which was nice if it was getting too cold. The only thing I didn’t like about this hotel was they don’t have irons in the room! I was there for a business trip and my clothes were wrinkled from being In my luggage. I did request one from the front desk twice and said they would bring one up but never got around to it. Luckily my clothes were just a little wrinkled so I wasn’t too upset but I can imagine how this could be a bigger issue for someone with really wrinkled clothes. 

Overall, this was a great hotel choice and I would highly recommend this place to anyone just looking for the bare minimums in a hotel for their trip.

title: Amazing stay
text:
This is a brilliant hotel. The location is great for the subway and also walking distance to a lot of the main attractions.
Yes the rooms are small and there is a frosted glass door for the bathroom but there is plenty of room to unpack. There is a rail with hangers and also a large drawer under the bed. 
The room also has a safe that is easy to use for any valuables. The staff are all friendly and willing to help. They sorted a shuttle bus to the airport for us, let us have a later check out and stored luggage for us. 
Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to explore New York.

title: Amazing place to stay
text: Amazing service! There was always someone there to arrange for our luggage to be stored or to get it out of storage for us. The free luggage storage was perfect. The concierge was always available, friendly, and super helpful with subway directions. The free walking tour by Streetwise was also great, and I would highly recommend taking advantage of the opportunity! I would 100% stay here again. Also, the restaurant attached has happy hour from 12-6p with decent prices on drinks and $4 tacos on Taco Tuesday. Very happy, highly recommend. Hope to stay at a Pod Hotel again in the future!

title: Good location and a cosy pod for a short stay
text: Staying somewhere like NYC I knew that I wouldn't be spending much time in a hotel room so this was perfect for me. As the name suggests the rooms are small (and cosy) and there are some nice design features (coat hooks, shutters, bathroom dispensers, hairdryer, underbed storage) that make the space efficiently used. The only thing missing for me was a kettle but that's an American thing I think (and being English I love my tea!). I felt safe both in the hotel and in the surrounding area. Was a great mid town location and I would definitely consider staying there again when I return. Just be mindful of all the extra taxes and charges (every night I stayed there were 5 extra charges - NY State Sales Tax, NYC Hotel tax, NY Occ Tax, Facility Fee and Facility Fee tax totalling over $50 a night)

title: Tiny burrow near Grand Central
text:
Rooms in NYC in the autumn are notoriously expensive! I was delighted to stumble across Pod 39 a reasonably priced ‘tiny hotel’ a could of blocks from Grand Central.

The room is pretty tiny but all the essentials including a queen size bed, desk, flat screen TV and bright clean bathroom are included. When you are in NYC the plan is rarely to spend a lot of time in your hotel room and this is a perfect spot to launch from whether you are here for work or pleasure.  Very buzzy bar on the ground floor is a bonus. Detract a couple of stars as there was a strange, intermittent mechanical noise near my room last night (on the second floor). Was too tired to go downstairs and ask about it but it did make it a little challenging time fall asleep.

I would likely stay here again but request a higher floor.

title: Great short stay
text: Now as the hotel name suggests the rooms are really quite small but having said that they are completely adequate and it's a great base for visiting New York. The staff are really helpful at anytime of day and the rooftop bar is fantastic, where again the staff couldn't do enough for you. We would definitely stay here again on our return visit to New York.

title: Well situated
text: Had a five day stay in NYC - first time visitor so wanted to spend most of my time out of the hotel. Pod39 is perfect for that. In a good spot (midtown East) convenience stores in the vicinity, diners and restaurants as well. All you need and quite near Grand Central for the Subway. Clean hotel, nice little rooftop bar and by NYC standards not bad in price. Staff always helpful but wouldn’t call them enthusiastic. The rooms are small (but you know that when booking) and we have a small pod with bunk beds - worked well. Never felt the urge to use the restaurant or ground floor bar. But definitely worth it for a visitor looking to spend most of the time on the town.

title: Nothing special, but a good option in NYC
text: The room is small and absolutely basic. Even the most common items that you find in cheap hotels are not present here (like an alarm clock). But the room is clean, the location is OK (few blocks away from the Central Station) and the hotel is quiet, even with a pub at the ground floor. Staff is OK. In the lobby you can book a transfer for JFK, but beware with the driver, because he can try some trick to get more money from you (It's NYC...). The price is good, if compared with regular prices in NYC (very high). After all, I would stay there again.

title: Center of the City
text: Location is very central to UN, Grand Central and Lexington. Clean and comfortable. Design based on minimum space. Staff are friendly. There is a bar and restaurant at the lobby, as well as a roof top party place.

title: We loved Pod 39
text: Our room was perfect. Just what we needed, comfy bed, the shower was amazing in our bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop bar was icing on the cake after a long day. Excellent location!

title: Pod
text: Horribly overpriced.  If I’m going to do my business in the toilet in front of my significant other it would seem I am already paying a price.  Why pay for the experience.  Pay the same price a few blocks away and get twice the space.

title: Perfect for my first visit to NYC
text:
I arrived at the hotel after a long day of travelling, and managed to check in very quickly. Needless to say that my room was a very welcome sight! My bed was very comfortable, and the room was very clean. Although the air conditioning was noisy, it was effective. As mentioned by other reviewers, the room was small, but there was plenty of space for me and my roomie to move around in.

The hotel is in a good location - you can reach the nearest subway station on foot in just a few minutes. If you don't want to take a subway, it's easy to walk to quite a few attractions (e.g. Broadway and Times Square) from E 39 Street. Points of interest near to the hotel include the Chrysler Building and the UN Headquarters, and there are also quite a few small shops and cafés in the area. Check out the hotel's roof terrace, too - and don't forget to take your camera up there!

The hotel staff were all very friendly. The man in the breakfast room was very chatty and liked a joke - he told my tour guide that the Statue of Liberty had been closed "due to lack of interest"! :D The pastries served in the breakfast room were all freshly made in a nearby bakery (and were delicious!).

I must also mention the concierge staff, especially the man who helped me and my friend to buy some Broadway tickets. We were going out for the morning, and he said that he would call the agency when it opened to ask how much the tickets cost, and would keep a note for us for when we returned. When we got back to the hotel later on, he was getting into his car (his shift had just finished), but went out of his way to return to the desk and tell us what he'd found out.

The only negative thing I have to say is that the bathroom door was see-through! Apart from that, I really enjoyed my stay, and hope to return to NYC - and the hotel - at some point. :)

title: PLEASE DO NOT BE RIPPED OFF BY THE HOTEL
text:
I'm writing this review in the hope it will stop other people having to go through the nightmare I have experience after staying at the hotel. Pod 39 have taken £331 from my account on top of the £800 I paid for my accommodation. I have had to send copies of the bank transactions, get authorisation codes from the bank, and they are still saying it was a pre-authorisation. This is three weeks after getting home, endless emails and phonecall, it's just been awful. 

When I was looking to book I saw something like this written on a review by someone else, but as the other reviews were generally positive I ignored it. Booking.com have been beyond useless in offering any kind of support - the stress caused have been so bad I wish I had never been on the holiday. So please, choose somewhere else and save yourself the hassle.

title: NOT A HOTEL
text: The night we arrived after traveling 12 hours, we just wanted to check in. They claimed that all our credit cards were declined and we should pay in cash. We gave them euro just for the first night, until we were be able to communicate with our bank in the morning. They did not accept them and they insisted on cash without giving us the room. After we insisted that our cards were functional , they finally accepted the payment by card. They charged us with the whole amount (7nights stay) from the first night. They also charged us 30$ per night as a damage  deposit. We supposed to take back the deposit at our check out but one month after our check out, we are still claiming the refund. Concerning the hotel, we could say that it is a hostel than a hotel. The staff is rude and they did not behave like a hotel staff. The room was very small, there was no space for our luggage. It is very difficult to take a shower though water drops as rain. The only good thing was that the room was clean.

title: A Prison Cell
text:
Slightly better than the dirt hole I slept in while in the military. When we opened the door I thought it was a joke; bunk beds! It closely resembled a prison cell but was much smaller. The room was so small (about 90sq ft) I had to put the luggage into the bath room to step inside. With no more rooms and four days fully prepaid (it was not cheap), there were no other options. 

This Disabled cane-walking Vet and my “celly” had a miserable time and it all but ruined our NY trip. We are both over 50 and the bunk beds and maneuvering around the cell were an added stress. The ladder rungs were like cheese slicers on the feet. “Hip & Trendy?” I nearly broke my trendy hip coming down from the top bunk. This term is nothing more than an excuse for cramped and uncomfortable. 

The cell had an attached bathroom with a sliding glass door. It was half frosted and offered little to no privacy. Our toilet lid was broke, however it was quickly fixed. There is one very narrow long shelf that things would fall from. The sink was small with no room to place anything. The single faucet knob offered no pressure adjustment. The shower had the same single knob and a full curtain that would flow inward and stick to your body. We suggest using your own shampoo and conditioner, as the cell-supplied were low quality. The towels were thin and there was no out-of-shower mat. We just used another towel. 

The cell had one tiny shuttered window behind the beds that would offer minimum light when opened. It only added to the claustrophobic feeling. The metal shelf located and each bunk had a plug for convenient charging. I swung my hand while sleeping and everything fell to the bottom bunk. 

The hotel staff were very friendly and seemed to be this places only saving grace. It is in a good location with about a five minute walk to Grand Central Station. There are a few coffee shops close by which is rather nice since your room won’t have any. 

As a frequent world traveler and not one to complain much, I can honestly say this is the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed in...by far!

title: Decent stay
text: Stayed here for 3 nights.  It's a good location with lots of places within walking distance, not that touristy and there are plenty of  places to eat and drink nearby.  As others have said, the rooms are small but that really wasn't a problem for us as we didn't plan to spend a great deal of time in there.  I would say this hotel would appeal to younger travellers really.  It has a couple of trendy bars but they were both really, really busy with non-residents. The roof top bar is great but we couldn't get a seat and the music was just too loud for a couple of 47-51 yo's tbh! I wouldn't stay here again but that doesn't mean I don't recommend it.  There are so many different places and areas to stay in New York and if we were returning, we'd want to explore another neighbourhood.  N.B there is a daily charge for the 'facilities', $20 plus tax. We still aren't really sure what this covers and the receptionist couldn't expand apart from saying it was to cover printing (we did actually need to print an email too!) and leaving luggage....I'm sure it's in the small print of the booking details somewhere so I won't be taking it further but it's worth planning for.

title: Loves this hotel
text:
Although the rooms are small I found this hotel was perfect for a short trip. There wasn't anywhere to put items away however after living out of a suitcase for 2 weeks I didnt really mind. The rooms feature bunk beds with a tv on each bunk, a desk, a safe, a hairdryer and complimentary toiletries.
I was amazed how, for a small room, there was alot of plugs and USB points especially by the bed.
We went to the rooftop bar on 2 occasions and we were very impressed with the view although it can become very busy. 
This hotel is in an amazing location with easy access to grand central with a shuttle train to time square (although this is only a short walk). I feel like this hotel is at the heart of Manhattan.

title: New York
text:
Hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Perfect location for seeing the sites and shopping.
Roof top bar was nice although decor a little tired.
Would definitely recommend this hotel, just as described.

title: A great stay at POD 39 Hotel
text: A great stay. The Midtown location is perfect for walking (we walked all over including Central Park, Greenwich Village, The Highline at Hudson Docks, East Village, Chelsea) and exploring Manhattan. Five minutes walk from Grand Central Station. I would highly recommend Scotty’s Diner, one block away and five minutes walk at 336 Lexington Ave., for early (7:30am as it gets very busy) morning  breakfast - Eggs Benedict and omelettes were  highlights with continuous coffee and iced water refills. It’s a great way of fueling up for the day ahead and sampling New York life!  There is a daily happy hour in the modern downstairs bar and a buzzy rooftop garden and bar open till late. A special mention: Stevie, the POD’s Concierge, was of great help to us and a source of advice, especially, concerning the excellent walks, two of which we took part in. These walking tours are run by Streetwise NY and are really great. Our guide, David, was brilliant, gave us a New Yorker’s insight, led us on routes and to destinations that added to our experience  and had entertaining anecdotes. Minor irritations were the $150 credit card security charge taken at Check-In, but, which could take up to 2 weeks to be refunded after Check-Out. Also, the daily Facilty Charge of $20 should be highlighted more when booking. But, these are minor quibbles and did not detract from a great stay. Location is super. The room was everything we required - small as all New York rooms are, but, spotless with thermostatic air conditioning. We availed of daily room service. There was an ice station on the floor above. Very comfortable Queen Anne bed. Great shower. Thankyou to the POD 39 team. We’ll be back! Hasta la vista😎!

title: Boutique hotel
text:
Great hotel. Just off Times sq/Hells kitchen. Lots a good eateries nearby and the theatres. The rooms are small, which I knew, but clean and well maintained. Staff helpful. If your flight is after checkout time they have a secure well organised room for your luggage.

Would stay again

title: Great rooftop bar with wonderful views
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Pod 39 in April 2019.  The rooftop bar was one of the things that encouraged me to book this hotel, and it did not disappoint! The rooftop has amazing views, and is always lively.  The drinks and food inside the bar/restaurant area were amazing, and I had something to drink or eat there almost daily.  

The rooms were small but unlike some, I felt this added to the NY experience.  As a solo traveler it was big enough for me, and that was all I needed.  The single bed was comfortable, and I had no trouble falling asleep.  

The next time I go to NYC this is where I plan to stay!  Loved it!

title: Muy buena experiencia
text: El servicio del Hotel es muy bueno, los chicos de la recepción muy cálidos y amables, siempre dispuestos a colaborar ante cualquier consulta. Está excelentemente ubicado, a unas pocas cuadras de la Estación Central, desde donde te moves a cualquier lado. El barrio super lindo y seguro!! Una noche cenamos en el Resto y la comida super rica!! Lo único que puedo detallar es que estaba en remodelación la fachada y no pudimos apreciar el edificio para ponerme exquisito. Altamente recomendable!

title: Cute and Cosy Room
text: I really enjoyed my stay here; the room, as advertised, is definitely small but by no means cramped. There was enough space for a desk, bed, and a separate shower room, and I never felt like I needed any more (especially since I spent most of my time out in NYC). The front desk staff were so friendly and helpful, especially the concierge, and the decoration downstairs is wonderful, very modern. It's just central enough, although that does depend on where you want to go, but it's still only a 10-15 minute walk minimum to a lot of key sites like the Empire State Building and Times Square (and very close to Grand Central for the subway).

title: Great concept for a city like New York
text: Great concept for a city like New York. We had a room of only 8 square meters, with a bunk bed, and a private bath room with shower. I would have prefered a closet over a table with chair, because no wit took a bit of organizing to get everything sorted. There was no room to keep a suitcase open, so we used the table as closet, with two piles of clothes 😊. One downside was the airconditioning blowing in the face of the one that slept in the bottom bunk bed, but we solved that by sleeping the other way around (head where the feet were supposed to be). Unfortunately no room with a view, but not all rooms can be at the street side. Very quiet room though (we slept at the end of the hallway which probably helped). At ground level there is a bar, which produced one hell of a sound when we arrived, so I was afraid for all the noise, but even though we only slept at the fifth floor, we didn’t hear a thing! All in all, a very very small room, adequately furnished and cleaned, but you really don’t need more because you spend so little time there (some nights even less than 7 hours 😊).

title: Right size for great lodging
text:
I read many comments saying that thw rooms are very small, but believe, it is really very small, but this is space enough for 1 person. Everything is cool, modern, very well planned to a comfortable stay! The RoofTop is terrific! The restaurant has a wonderful deco!
The location wouldn't be better!
My only negative point was the frontdesk woman...she was quite rude and impacient when I asked for explanation about my bill...
If I come back to NY, I'll stay there again...

title: Clean and hip, but teeny tiny.
text: As my title states, the room is shockingly small. Almost "cell" small...as what one may imagine the size of a prison cell is like. Not sure if there are larger rooms for two people, but this was barely enough for one. I did get used to it and for the most part it provided what I needed, except for a full length mirror...there was only a bathroom mirror from the shoulders up. The staff was nice and the place is efficient. Good location.

title: Cozy and clean
text:
Samantha was very nice and helpful and put me in a quiet room. I had a single room and it was incredibly clean. Sheets on the bed and everything else about the bed was excellent. 

I only had a handbag so the space for me was fine. If you have luggage then the only place to put it is under the bed (a carry-on may fit in the open closet).

The only thing I didn't like was the resort fee, which I had missed when I booked. I wasn't expecting that given Pod 39 is not a place with amenities.

title: Very Good Little Hotel
text: I love this little hotel.  It's located in quite a easy area [midtown, Eastside] and the rooms aren't nearly as tiny as I thought they'd be.  To be sure, they are small; but the room I stayed in was roomy enough for me to work, walk around and even put up a full ironing board and iron.  The rooftop bar area was also quite nice; I didn't visit it every evening because it's quite popular and I needed more quiet.  But it was lovely on a hot summer night.  The food was also pretty good.  And I found the staff to be more than a joy! They are, almost without exception, patient, professional, courteous and good humored.  And frankly, they're all supercuts; it must be a prerequisite! All in all, I'd stay here again. [If I have one teeny quibble, it's that my room didn't get cleaned every day unless I called downstairs to request it and then it was "light cleaning" meaning new towels and making up the bed.  I usually care much more about this kind of thing but a combination of an unsuccessful trip and otherwise stellar service make it a minor quibble].

title: Small room but all you need!
text: We stayed at Pod 39 for 4 nights and had a great stay. The rooms are small, but given this is New York you won't find much bigger without paying through the nose for it. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There is a resort fee to be paid on check-in for each day of your stay so something to be mindful of. The elevators are a bit slow, but other than that the amenities were great. The location is great too, we walked to a lot of places from the hotel, and it is close the Grand Central so anywhere you need a train/subway to is easy to get to as well.

title: Boa hospedagem em Manhattan
text:
Eu e meu marido nos hospedamos no Pod 39 de 13 a 17 de agosto e gostamos muito do hotel, pois o mesmo entrega tudo o que propõe. Trata-se de um hotel com prático, que oferece suítes realmente pequenas, mas suficiente pra quem ficará o dia todo passeando e voltará ao hotel somente para tomar banho e dormir. Sua localização é muito boa, está há duas quadras da Grand Central Terminal, há 10 minutos de caminhada até a 5ª Avenida e 15 minutos até a Times Square. Com relação a limpeza, está ok para os padrões americanos.
O hotel cobra taxa de Resort Fee de USD 23,00 por dia, taxa esta que não entendi muito bem o que oferece em troca, talvez somente o Wi-Fi que funciona bem.
Em termos de segurança, o hotel é bem tranquilo. Há um Rooftop, que inclusive recebe pessoas que não estão hospedadas, mas há segurança e controle de acesso. Inclusive esse Rooftop é bem bacana para um drink.
Enfim, voltaria a me hospedar no Pod 39, devido a localização e ao custo beneficio, já que em Manhattan as diárias dos hotéis são bem altas.

title: Du temps pour moi!
text: La chambre que j'ai eu au Pod 39 était petite, mais je savais déjà ça avant d'arriver, un lit simple, une télé, une salle de bain complète et franchement c'est tout ce dont j'avais besoin. Après tout, nous n'y sommes que pour dormir normalement lorsque nous sommes en voyage.  Le personnel est friendly, l'hôtel trendy, la terrasse sur le toit est magnifique, c'est propre et pas bruyant, à moins que quelqu'un ne parle dans le corridor. Tout cela a un prix et c'est cher, mais raisonnable compte tenu que nous sommes au centre-ville de Mahattan. J'ai aimé qu'il y ait de petites épiceries, une pharmacie, un Starbucks, un salon de coiffure et quelques restos de quartier tout près. C'est également très près de la Grand Centrale Station et de Time Square.

title: So noisy!
text: The location of this place is fantastic, especially if you need to hop on the 7 to get to the US Open. Unfortunately, the hvac system is disturbingly loud and has a constant humming sound. It caused the floor in our first room to vibrate. My wife has tinnitus and wasn’t able to sleep even with ear plugs. The front desk personnel are aware of the issue and said that it has something to do with how the AC was installed. Super bummed because otherwise the place would have been great!

title: Average Hotel
text: The hotel is situated conveniently in Midtown Manhattan. However, the rooms are small and cramped. The bathroom is not very private. Moreover, the staff was not very respectful in my opinion. The price was also too high, considering our stay was not very pleasant. There are many better hotels in New York City.

title: Excelente estadia
text:
El hotel es re lindo y moderno PERO OJO a no quejarse por el tamaño de las habitaciones, esta perfectamente aclarado cuando se reserva y se paga por ello, si no les gusta NO RESERVEN Y LUEGO VAYAN A QUEJARSE a recepcion como vi que hicieron durante mi estadia.
Obviamente que el precio es como todo en NY, es caro tal vez considerando los tamaños de las habitaciones pero intenten reservar algo mas grande por menor precio...no van a poder!

Adems la ubicacion es genial. Cerca de todo 39 y 3. Hay starbucks por todos lados (como en todo NY) y muchos otros lugares para desayunar. 
Yo volveria sin dudas, eso si, yo me quede 6 noches, luego me fui a un hotel mas grande por 4 noches mas y senti la diferencia de espacio. Pero bueno yo sabia como era. Para estadias largas no se si esta tan bueno, ero dependera del presupuesto de cada uno.

En resumen, me encanto y volveria a pesar de lo mini de las habitaciones.

title: Perfect
text: All I really needed was a bed and a bathroom, and that's what I got! Room was clean. Had a TV. The TV had outputs in the wall which was great. Room had its own temp control. They had a cool lounge and game room in lobby. Boardgames also, people were chilling and having fun. Rooftop bar was closed for "weather," nor sure why it was a beautiful day. Maybe because it was very hot and humid? Booze is overpriced, but hey, thats just NY.

title: HORRIBLE
text: I only put 1 Star because I couldn’t give a lower score. The staff here is horrible, disrespectful and downright arrogant. I attended an event here at their rooftop and coming down, the elevator was stuck for over 30 minutes. When we  pulled the emergency bell in the elevator, the FDNY showed up to get us out. The security at the hotel blamed us for crowding the elevator which was a complete lie!!! There were no apologies and no type of communication or even acknowledging the wrongdoing. If the elevator is ever close to capacity, hire someone to stay in and operate it, don’t blame people for using it or LIE and claim it’s their fault. Safe to say, I will not be returning to this distasteful, overpriced, overhyped excuse for a hotel

title: Uma pérola em Midtown!
text: Ficámos num quarto com beliche, que foi o suficiente para dormirmos. Todos os dias estava sempre tudo super limpo. O hotel é cool e de decoração jovem e está localizado a uma caminhada aceitável de Times Square. Em Midtown, acaba por se conseguir fazer tudo a pé. Recomendo vivamente a quem não dá mais importância à limpeza e decoração do que a grandes larguezas.

title: Great stay, but beware resort fees
text:
The stay was great and the staff super friendly.  Close walk from Grand Central and then a quick hop to everywhere we wanted to go. Super quiet given the location and the popularity of the lobby bar. Price reasonable for Midtown location.

However, the $23/day resort fee for services that I'd never use other than "free" wifi is simply outrageous for a room the size we had. I won't stay here again simply for that reason, even though the place was great.

title: Gran ubicación. Impecable limpieza
text: La ubicación es inmejorable para el turista, muy cerca del metro y bien comunicado. La habitación es pequeña, creo que como en todos los hoteles de Nueva York, pero estaba impecable. Perfecto para una estancia en pareja. Nos encantó la terraza.

title: Wow, what a treasure!
text:
I agree the room is small but the City is where you want to be so get OUT of your CLEAN room. My 16 year old niece and I stayed in a bunk bed room based on the suggestion of the reservation desk. Perfect for us.
Roof top bar was nice to chill while our room was being finished. The view! Wow.
Coffee at the breakfast bar with Joel, delicious coffee and conversation.
Empellon Al Pastor has the perfect food and drink for a night cap. Great service too.
Steve, the concierge, will make planning your days easy. He's my new BFF.

title: It was a great stay
text: I absolutely recommebd Pod39. Rooms are small but comfortable, fully furnished and very clean. Restaurant Al Pastor is delicious and the roof at 17th floor has an amazing view to NYC (see the picture).

title: Hyggeligt hotel med skøn beliggenhed
text:
Smagfuldt indrettet værelse. Den hyggeligste tagterasse/bar hvor man dog skal være over 21 år, hvis man benytter den efter kl 16. Det var lidt en streg i regningen. 
Der er et vældigt leben på barerne i stueetagen men ikke noget der generede os på værelset. Kan varmt anbefale hotellet.

title: small but perfectly adequate
text: Spent 5 nights here on business. Very small room but super clean and surprisingly quiet. Bar and restaurant on first floor nice with decent food. Good location near Grand Central; Staff helpful and friendly

title: Pod 39 is The Best
text: We had a great stay at Pod 39! We stayed for six nights and the place was quiet, clean, friendly and fun. The location was perfect for us near Grand Central Station but far enough to be quiet. The rooftop is fantastic and special. I would recommend this place for travelers looking for a nice, clean and unique experience. The workers at the hotel were super friendly and always helpful. We would stay again for sure. Enjoy!

title: Rooftop Bar très cool !
text: Rooftop bar assez chouette peut-être un peu select mais si vous insistez un peu on vous laissera passer. Chouette pour boire un verre ou deux et manger des tapas en profitant de la vue. Belle adresse !

title: Great location at reasonable price
text: We had a great stay at pod 39. It was in a great location so we could walk to a lot of things we wanted to do/see. Rooms are a bit small but to be expected in NYC. a clean and comfortable hotel in NYC

title: Nice Hotel
text: Small rooms but have everything you need to spend a few days in New York. Great showers, nice beds, friendly and helpful staff. Affordable hotel with a great location in Manhattan. Very clean, good wi-fi.

title: super
text: Super clean, super safe, super friendly and helpful staff, super locations, super affordable. Tiny rooms but who cares? Who stays in their room in NYC other than to sleep? We stay here 4-5 times/year.

title: Affordable Posh stay
text: I was very impressed with our stay at Pod.  It definitely suites our needs since we were going to be very busy on our trip.  The showers were great, beds were comfy, bar was so beautiful but by far the thing that sent this place over the top was their accommodating staff.  Everyone was super helpful, especially Ronni<3.  She went above and beyond to look after some packages for me and accommodate us no problem.  Will definitely stay again.

title: Tres pratique
text: Tres petite chambre mais bon rapport qualité prix pour new york. Il manque peut etre un ou deux m2 pour ouvrir les valises.. hotel calme, la clim fait du bruit par moment... bonne literie ! Tres bon emplacement pour visiter new york a pied

title: World’s tiniest hotel rooms!
text: “Pod” is the right name for it! The room is truly tiny, however, it did have almost everything I needed, was clean, and the bed was comfortable. The wi-fi was reasonably good. The price was high for the size of the room, but you’re paying to stay in Manhattan, and the rates were reasonable considering the location. The one thing that I would suggest adding to the room is a mini-refrigerator. That would be a huge help. However, I”m not sure exactly where they’d put it. There’s not a spare inch. It would also be helpful to have a few vending machines in the hotel for snacks and sodas. There’s an ice dispenser on the 15th floor.

title: Great stay at POD 39
text:
The POD 39 is a good small hotel next to Central station.
The rooms are small, but if you are aware of that it is a small problem if you take the price and geography into consideration.
Only drawback is the roof top bar, that is not only for hotel guests. This creates a lot of traffic at the elevators and noise from the roof top.
But all in all a good experience and I would defininetly stay there again.

title: Good hotel, reasonable price
text: It’s not easy to find a reasonably priced, but decent hotel in Manhattan- but Pod 39 hotel really fits the bill! I stayed here over a weekend as a solo traveller, and the hotel was exactly what I needed. It was a single room, which had everything I needed for a short break. Good location for sightseeing as lots of key places are walkable from the hotel, and Grand Central station gives access to the subway for trips further afield.

title: Great hotel for a great price
text:
This month i stayed at pod 39 for the second time. I like this hotel because the rooms are nice and clean (not very big), location is closeby grand central and the staff is friendly.
However, the neighbourhood is not very touristy.
There are lovely restaurants on a walking distance (murray hill/kips bay).

title: Ottima posizione!
text:
L'hotel si trova in una posizione ottima. La nostra camera era pulita e ben tenuta, ma estremamente piccola per gli standard europei. 
Da migliorare il bagno: perché quella porta a vetri solo parzialmente oscurata e la doccia con la tenda no....

title: Wonderful experience! Will visit again
text: Have stayed here on 2 visits to New York and could not recommend it enough! Felt very safe in the rooms (I am a nervous traveler). The bedrooms are quite small but very comfortable, complete with a tv for each bed. The staff could not have been more pleasant and were very accommodating when we asked for one room to be changed to a double room. It is in an incredible location, close to grand central station and the river for transport (and fireworks on 4th of July). Would recommend the breakfast in the bar downstairs, very affordable for a good New York breakfast. Also the Italian restaurant on the corner has amazing food for couples or families.

title: Great Essentials
text:
I was working on a project with the UN when I stayed here. The proximity to the UNHQ was a big selling point for this hotel. 
I thought it was very well located for a midtown hotel but if I wasn't in NYC for work, I would find things to be far from here. 
The hotel was amazing - the staff was super friendly and the little bar on the ground floor really was a great place to hang out and meet people. 
The room was a little small (it would have been cramped if there was more than just me) but had all the necessities and was very very comfortable. I would highly recommend this for young travelers who are in New York for work.

title: Cool hotel at a great location and an affordable price!
text: Finally an affordable hotel that's cool (and not seedy) and at a great location.  Perfect for two people on the go.  Modern furnishings, quiet hallways, great AC, plenty of hot water and one of the best affordable, open-air rooftop bars around.  We'll be back!

title: Comfortable launch pad for our NYC adventures
text: I stayed in one of the bunk bed rooms with my 78 year old uncle (Detroit raised, US Expat living in Germany, bicycling enthusiast). This was the perfect place for us--very comfortable beds, good outlet access for our electronic devices, clean and modern, and a great base for lots of walking, subway rides, and buses. Were were there over the 4th of July and enjoyed watching the fireworks and dancing on the rooftop (there was an extra $35 charge for hotel guests for rooftop access for the 4th). The breakfast provided for an extra charge was a bit heavy on the carbs, but great conversation with the man who runs the breakfast service. There is fresh fruit & other food items nearby available for sale. We were older than most of the guests, but they were from all over world and staff and guests were very friendly and helpful, we fit right in, great time!

title: Recomendo!
text:
Achamos o hotel excelente pela localização e pela limpeza. 
O quarto realmente não é nada grande, mas se a intenção for passear a maior parte do dia e só voltar para o hotel de noite, recomendo. 
Fica bem próximo à Central Station.

title: essentials.
text: If you’re going to New York alone or with your significant other and will ONLY be sleeping in the room and not hanging out. Then this hotel is the one to get. The shower was nice and the room was very clean. But just like the hotel suggests of course all rooms are “Pod” like Rooms. So if you are someone used to big amounts of space you will feel very claustrophobic. This was perfect for me as I was going on a quick 2 day business trip to New York and this was very close to where I needed to be.

title: very good value for money for NYC!
text:
Clean, comfortable room. Good service (soap, towels, hairdryer...).The staff was friendly and helpful. Well located. 
Perfect for for business trips and city walkers :)

There is a roof top for a drink and a restaurant/bar for breakfast.

title: Awesome place!
text:
Just as a disclaimer, the rooms are tight. In saying that, it’s perfect for people who aren’t looking at staying in their room all day (I mean who would in New York). It’s located only a few streets away from Grand Central station which is great for getting out and about. There’s also plenty of good choices for food (highly recommend trying out the cream cheese bagels from the carts on nearby streets). 

Roomwise, they are great. They are very soundproof. I know this is the case because we had a room next to the lifts and heard nothing. The beds were made everyday and fresh towels were provided. Shampoo, conditioner and body wash was heaps. The bedding was comfortable and we slept well the whole time we were there. We also had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Having little charging areas near the bed was also helpful. We had room 1514 as a recommendation towards a good view. 

The service provided by Pod was awesome! They helped us store our bags after we checked our, made sure we had transfers and everything else in between. 

Overall, it’s definitely somewhere I would stay at again! Well done Pod!

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: I had an interior room on the 3rd floor. Room was clean, modern, cute. Main floor restaurant had great coffee/bagels in the morning. Roof top bar was crowded a little loud for me, but looked fun.  Front desk/concierge super friendly and helpful. Well located. Easy access to Laguardia and for walking around up and down town.

title: Small, but has all you need!
text: Clean, comfortable room. The staff was friendly and helpful. The shower, sink and toilet are is well designed. The bed was very comfortable. There is a small tv, but at least there is one. The only thing I wish was in the room was a small refrigerator.

title: Accomodating to Special Requests
text:
I stay at the Pod 39 when visiting family in Murry Hill.  As a regular customer, the manager of the hotel has indicated my special accommodations and room location preference into the system for future stays.  In addition, I'm encouraged to email the manager about upcoming reservations to ensure the preferred rooms are held.

The location is great and walking difference to everything.  The walking tours are fun and educational. 

Staff and concierge is very friendly.

title: Nice Place with a Great view
text:
Nice place with a great location! Beautiful view from the rooftop.
Easy check-in and check out. Functional decoration. Excellent for one person and enjoy a few days in New York.
In overall evaluation, it`s worth the visit.

title: Great place to hang out for business or pleasure!
text: Was on a trip to NYC for business and pleasure and Pod 39 was a very charming place to stay. Beautiful rooftop patio, great staff, affordable place in a great location. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Muito Agradável
text:
Nunca tinha estado num quarto tão pequeno na minha vida, mas era agradável e limpíssimo.
Excelente localização, próxima da Central Station e das principais atracções turisticas e um rooftop muito agradável, com vistas da cidade e bem frequentado.
Recomendo

title: Хороший вариант на Манхеттене!
text: Останавливался на 4 дня.  Одноместный номер . Маленький конечно. Но если там только ночевать. То вариант хороший. Так как приходил ночью и рано утром уходил. При заезде бронируют на карте 30 долларов на ночь депозит. При выезде возвращают. Проблем не было. Хорошее местоположение. Все рядом. В 10 минутах ходьбы до Таймс сквэр. Эмпайр стэйт и смотровой Top Of Rock. Для того чтобы посмотреть самые популярные места самый раз. Остался всем доволен. Не смотря что на крыше отеля находится руф-бар это никак не мешало качеству сна. Довольно тихо и хорошо. Советую!

title: Hotel a 5 minutes de grand centrale et 15 minutes de TIMES SQUARE à pied
text:
Tres bon Hotel petite Chambre propre et neuve très confortable bonne literie chambre moderne bien conçue fonctionnel ménage impeccable le + coffre fort de bonne taille et très pratique ce qui manquerai petite bouilloire pour Thé ou café et personnel réception parlant un peu le français
Au RDC très bon bar restaurant plat excellent prix raisonnable Au 17 eme étage terrasse bar très agréable lieu branché bcp de monde le weekend   très belle vue sur Manhattan

title: Great place at a great location
text:
We were there from June 21 to June 24, the first room assigned had a weird smell (like old moist carpet), we quickly requested a change of room and we're giving a new one without any hassle. They have great service and a very courteous staff. For those wondering about parking, the hotel got an agreement with the parking company nearby, instead of paying 65USD, you pay 35USD per 24hr stay. 

The new room was better, the bathroom all fully functional, you have a very easy to use safe. The rooftop bar is a bit crowded but a nice view toward the city. All in all, a comfortable hotel room, great customer service, a rooftop bar and all that at a great price compared to the surrounding hotels. I highly recommend.

title: Reasonable location, fairly basic
text:
In terms of location this hotel is within easy walking distance of many of the main tourist must-dos. It makes no bones about the fact the fact that it’s not a luxury hotel and it really isn’t. We wanted somewhere clean with a comfortable bed  to rest our heads after a busy day’s sightseeing so top of the range accommodation was not required. And we got exactly what we paid for - we knew it was a budget hotel. Other than the most basic of toiletries and a hairdryer there are no extras - no tea and coffee making facilities, no iron or ironing board. One very irritating thing was that only one of the lifts was working throughout our 5 day stay in a hotel with many floors and a rooftop bar!
There is an ice machine on one of the upper floors, but no-one tells you about it when you check in - we only found out about because we visited the bar and asked for ice and it was the bar staff who told us. It’s this lack of basic information and a general unhelpfulness that caused me to mark it down to a 3 rather than 4. So for example the night before we left we asked the concierge to arrange a taxi for us in the morning but he refused to do it because we weren’t travelling to the airport - we were going by luxury coach to our next destination. He told us to hail a cab on the street, which was not easy because out side the hotel there was loads of scaffolding restricting our view, so we had to trundle two heavy suitcases up to Lexington Avenue. It felt pretty disobliging to be honest. 
In summary, stay if you are on a limited budget and want to be in a reasonable location, but it certainly isn’t grand and the staff aren’t that great.

title: Suburb character hotel
text:
A zany hotel immaculately clean, small rooms but ideal for sleep, ablutions and out you go exploring.  There are lounges though downstairs.  The most fabulous concierge in Stephen.
A roof top bar/restaurant well patronised by young people
Very well located near eateries and Underground

title: Good for short stay
text:
Located about 5 min walking distance from Grand Central Station. 
There is a pub on ground and top floor so one of lift is reserved to their guess. You can noise from the noise but considered acceptable. 
Size of room is smaller than the other Pod hotel. 
I was staying in a single room and only have one piece of luggage, which is just have enough space. 
Toilet is in a rectangle shape which toilet bowl facing the wall. You may hit wall easy if you are average big size. 
There is concierge which can arrange transport for you. 
You may want to arrange from them otherwise taxi fare or UBer can cost a huge bomb.

title: Room too small and not well made. not so clean
text:
I was excited about the idea of this hotel but i got disappointed.
I couldn't find any room available on the official website so I wrote them. They only give me the chance for a double room. I asked to upgrade in case they had a bigger room (i read a lot of review talking about how small the rooms are). The day after it was available online. I wrote them but they didn't answered for days and the price got higher and higher. Finally when we arrived we could have it. I actually don't know how the room could be smaller. The QUEEN POD is small and not well organized at all. The bed is small for two people. You just have 3 hanger and no closet. The bathroom is useless big. The room was so unconfortable. We didn't have space for anything. Fortunately we were there just to sleep... It was not as clean as I thought. The glass of the window were dirty when we arrived and they got worst while our stay... The fan works either the light is on or off so you always have this noise and it seems like a jetplane that is about to take off. We probably had air conditioner engines so It was quite unbearable. I wouldn't actually come back. For the same price you can get something better... The staff is super kind althought Communication has been very difficult.
The rooftop it's nice and if you are guest of the hotel you can go easily.
The location is top to take underground to go everywhere. It is a working area so you won't find much for have dinner/drink etc.

title: Only if you are desperate.
text: I am from NYC - I am used to tiny hotel rooms. BUT - this is beyond tiny. When you open the door -you hit the bed. You can lie in bed and turn on the shower. There is only a sliver of a window. Claustrophobic!!!!!!

title: Très bien situé, mais perfectible
text:
A 3 rues de l'Empire State Building, et l'un des premiers hôtels desservis en arrivant de l'aéroport, on ne peut pas faire beaucoup mieux pour un tarif de 100 euros par nuit à NYC!
Les chambres sont petites mais propres (les femmes de ménage très efficaces et gentilles), et fonctionnelles.
Cependant nous avons déploré deux choses : le bruit infernal de la climatisation en plein hiver, d'abord. Il vous réveille en plein milieu de la nuit à plusieurs reprises.
Et l'antipathie des personnels d'accueil. Une remarque qui montre bien le je-m'en-foutisme ambiant? Nous avons changé d'heure le jour de notre départ, et devions donc prendre la navette et l'avion. PERSONNE n'a pensé à nous le dire, ni à changer la pendule, ni à nous appeler dans la chambre. 
Et le payement de l’hôtel a mis 3 semaines à être prélevé sur ma carte. On a vraiment l'impression que ces gens n'en ont rien à faire.
Au final, pour le prix et la localisation, nous y retournerions quand même.

title: Clean, comfortable accommodations at a reasonable price.
text: Stayed at Pod 39 in New York City while there for a business meeting.  The hotel was close to the meeting site and very affordable.  While other hotels were in the $500-700 range, Pod was in the low $300s.  Room was small but had all the features one would need - comfortable desk, very good free internet, clean, modern bathroom. good towels, and very comfortable bed.  Of course, the room is small but for 1 person on a business trip, who needs more?  And the front desk staff were friendly, accommodating and easy to deal with.

title: Location and Price Convenience
text: If you are trying to cut the cost of a visit to Manhattan without sacrificing location, Pod 39 is the hotel for you. The rooms are small, but clean and provide all amenities needed: rainfall shower head, in-room safe, desk, TV. I would especially recommend this location if you are a theater goer as it is a short walk to Time Square. The front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant.

title: Prima hotel
text: Hotel is perfect gelegen, op loopafstand van Central Station. Kamers zijn precies zoals omschreven wordt, niet meer en niet minder. Erg schoon, de kamer heeft alles wat je nodig hebt. Personeel is behulpzaam. Er zit een bar beneden en een rooftopbar, dat is ook een pluspunt.

title: Small rooms, prime location
text: Ideal for a traveler who does not intend to spend too much time in their actual room.  Great location, beautiful rooftop bar.  Clean rooms (though small, almost to the point of being claustrophobic).  There was sometimes a long line for the elevators, which just seems to be an issue in NYC.  I would have liked access to a fitness facility.

title: Great stay
text: Visited the hotel for 5 nights as part of a holiday/business trip. Check in was quick and easy, the room was snug but absolutely fine! It was clean and tidy, and provided the perfect base for our stay. Could be noisy outside but this is expected from a hotel in New York, and after the first night we got used to it anyway. Rooftop bar is very cool, it did get very busy on an evening, even during the week, but would definitely check it out even just for one drink! On our final day we didn’t fly out until late night and the hotel were happy to store our luggage for us which was great.

title: Almost Perfect Stay
text: The location was perfect for us. We arrived in the city after a stay in Orient and took a Jitney into the city with the drop off point right down the street from this hotel. Everyone was friendly. Check in was quick. There was a line for the roof top bar but hotel guests used different elevators so that was nice. We had a corner room It was awesome. Great views. Efficient room. Housekeeping staff were helpful and friendly. The only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star rating is there was no free coffee area in the morning and when I ordered food I had to go down to the lobby to pick it up. I was in my pajamas so it was a little inconvenient but everyone was friendly about it. The roof views and vibes are awesome. I only went up during the day so there were no crowds. It was fabulous. Great neighborhood. Close to Grand Central Station. Will stay here again.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Just like other Manhattan’s budget hotel, the room was really small especially when there’re 4 luggage with us. But it was sparkling clean and comfortable. It was close to several Metro station and good diners and restaurants to have something to eat. Smooth checking-in process. A recommended place to stay in NYC.

title: Small Room but Excellent Location
text: The hotel is based about a 2 minute walk from Grand Central and near to various facilities within the city. It also has a rooftop bar, that while expensive does offer great views of the nearby monster buildings including the Empire State and Chrysler. The room was very small, but for a 3-day break that isn't important as chances are like us you just want to be within walking distance of the main sites.

title: Pod 39 5th to 10th June 2019
text:
Second time staying here this year 
I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough 
This hotel is so central and in a safe neighbourhood 
The staff are lovely and my room was really nice I booked a queen room 
The top roof bar is brilliant with lovely views
I will be back again

title: Friendly and fun
text: We loved our stay in Pod 39. Our room was compact with bunk beds, but well-equipped and very comfortable. There were good-sized luggage racks. The shower was great and came with shampoos, body wash and confitioner. The public areas were very comfortable and trendy. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. The location is very convenient, close to shops, sights and subway. One minor issue, the bars (at ground level and rooftop) are very busy and noisy with non-residents at yhe weekends. The residents lounge area (with sofas) is well away from this noise. Our 2nd floor bedroom was very quiet and not affected by any noise.

title: Functional, conveniently located, excellent value!
text: This is my third time staying in a pod hotel and first one at this particular one. Excellent experience every time! Their rooms are very small but extremely functional, every detail is thought of, from multiple outlets to areas to put your toiletries, etc. The staff was very helpful and the rooftop bar was great! The location is great, walking distance to many cool restaurants and sights and a short walk to the subway. I would definitely stay here again!

title: New York by Night
text:
I was recently in New York for the night after vacationing in London. 
I must say the staff was So very helpful with suggesting nearby places for dinner and where to catch my shuttle the next morning!! I will def make it a point to stay at the Pod 39 again!!! The room, bed linens, and shower were very very clean and I had a peaceful night's sleep!!! This is Everything I could ask for in a quick overnight stay.

title: Good location
text:
Overall, I had a good experience with this hotel. It's within walking distance of good restaurants and many attractions. Some things to consider, though:

1. The rooms are too small for two large suitcases but are good if all you're doing is sleeping.

2. The bathroom is not very private, since the dividing wall is only frosted glass.

3. The restaurant in the hotel does serve breakfast but it's not complimentary.

4. There is a service charge on top of the room fee that covers things like the phone (which we didn't use) and the wifi, which was on an open network.

title: Compact and Clean
text: Just what I was looking for in NYC. Pod 39 offered a very small single bed and bathroom in close proximity to just about whatever you need in the city. This place is well run, clean, and upbeat. The only downside is the price per square foot!

title: Super sejour
text: Les chambres sont petites mais disposent de tout le confort. La literie est très confortable. Les chambres sont très propres. Nous étions au 15 ème étages, les bruits de la ville étaient atténués et nous avions une vue sur le Chrysler building. Petit bémol, Il n'y a pas de nécessaire pour le café ou le thé à disposition.

title: Top location, excellent rooftop but claustrophobic rooms
text: If you go for a Pod, you have to be aware what can be expected. Claustrophobic small rooms but with all the efficiency you can have. Super clean, with safe, clean but small bathroom. Therefore, you get a great location with 42nd/Grand Central only three blocks away. In addition, they have a wonderful rooftop which is packed in Summer when the afterworkers come in (long queues in front of ground floor elevators). The elevators are the main problem of this hotel: as you have so many guests and rooftop visitors, the old elevators don’t cope with the masses. Sometimes, it takes you ages. This is really a big minus and the hotel hasn’t done anything on this persistent problem over the past years.

title: Excellent!
text: Great place to stay. It was very clean and functional. I do enjoy it! I love it. I stayed there by myself and I felt very safe. It has a beautiful bar in the terrace with lights. I didn't drink anything but I enjoyed the place.

title: Conference at the UN
text:
The room was good.  Small but practical and with everything.  The service was also good when I checked in and checked out.  Reasonable price.
There were always many young persons in the lobby.  The lobby bar was never empty.

title: Bueno pero demasiado pequeño y con baño de vidrio
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado y tiene una estética muy bonita, pero la habitación es demasiado pequeña y el baño es completamemte de vidrio, lo cual para una habitación tan pequeña puede tornarse incómodo. La relación precio calidad es buena pero creo que se puede mejorar.

title: Muy bonito hotel!
text: Éste mes de mayo estuvimos visitando New York con mi esposa, nos hospedamos en el pod ,muy bonito, pintoresco, excelente limpieza, mucha onda!!todo el día tiene movimiento su hermoso bar en planta baja y la hermosa terraza!!!!muy buena atención de todos, muy bien ubicado!!! Super recomendado!!!!!!!!

title: Perfectly placed
text: We had a late check in as we didnt land until 5.30 am and when we got to Pod 39 they had sold our room.   We were not pleased but they made up for it.  As the name implies the rooms are small but perfectly formed. Clean and functional.  They provide free tours of NY too we did 2 of them and they were very good. Would recommend and use again.

title: Great location and clean hotel
text:
Location 5 minute walk from central station
comfort - room small but clean and comfy - just need to make sure you find a place to put your bag.
price - reasonable for location

cons - lifts were very slow wouldn't want to be on top floors - also no coffee machine

title: Anniversary Trip
text: Hotel is centrally located to all major tourist attractions. Very clean and well maintained. Only issue during our stay was overcrowding on the elevators and eventually 2/3 broke. They were fixed but inconvenient for a while. Security should monitor elevator overcrowding.

title: Refreshing Experience
text:
Rooms are quiet, compact and very comfortable. All you need for a new, safe experience, in New York City. The staff is very helpful and kind.
The POD is in walking distance from Grand Central Station and Caff'e Venice. A bar with food is located at the hotel entrance.

title: Sensible but very loud lounge
text:
We love pod hotels but this one is very loud with people lining up to go tot he rooftop bar, the bouncer is loud and militant, very unpleasant. It felt like you are at a club. 

We will not stay here but other location.

title: Ottimo soggiorno
text: Siamo stati due anni di seguito a new york, ed abbiamo sempre soggiornato al pod39, nonostante le camere fossero piccole, si trova in un’ottima posizione, a 300metri dalla gran central station ed a 15 min a piedi da times square.... hotel pulito e funzionale... consiglio

title: Adorable! Centrally Located & Good Service!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Pod39! Our Queen room is adorable & cozy. Enough space for the two of us & our things. We couldn't fit the bags under the bed like you're supposed to, but we still had plenty of room. The bathroom could be a little more private without the glass door, but thats just a preference. The hotel is in a great spot! 3 blocks to Grand Central, which made getting around easy. There are also stores & restaurants closer by if you don't want to travel much. The housekeeping service was great! Room was fresh every night when we came back to home base, which I appreciated so much since we were exhausted after most days! Staff at the desk & concierge were friendly & got us a cab to the airport on the last day. It was very helpful since we used the subway or walked everywhere & honestly weren't experienced in flagging them down. Overall, we had a great time, good service & great location!

title: Prima  notte di Luna di Miele
text:
Alloggiano in questo Hotel per la prima notte della nostra luna di miele.
Arrivati facilmente alla struttura dall'aeroporto JFK tramite utilizzo di servizio Uber, veniamo accolti alla reception con molta simpatia e disponibilità. 
La struttura è moderna internamente, con bellissime colorazioni e design curato nei particolari. 
Le camere sono piccole, tipico standard americano, ma molto accoglienti, e disposte molto bene internamente.
La posizione dell'albergo è ottima per passeggiate notturne... facilmente raggiungibili i siti di interesse e diversi ristorantini ove poter ricaricare le forze.
Sicuramente dovessimo ritornare a New York terremo in considerazione questa struttura.

title: What a great find
text: This is one of the cutest hotels ever.  The rooms are small, bunk twin beds, but was perfect for our girls weekend in NYC.   There was an attached bathroom and everything was sparkling clean.  The entire staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was ready for check in by 10 a.m.   There is a wonderful roof top bar to enjoy but go early as it gets crowded because it's open to the public.   Located only a few blocks from Grand Central Station which was very convenient.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Ótima localização!
text:
Hotel muito descolado, apartamentos muito limpos, funcionários muito educados, restaurante/bar muito divertido, todo dia tem happy hour. Só não ganhou excelente, pleo tamanho do quarto =)
Porém, mesmo o quarto sendo pequeno, é muito aconchegante. 
Ótima localização, próximo a estação central de metrô, e da pra ir andando para várias atrações.

Vale a pena!

title: Combines business and family trip
text: It was a combined business and family trip with my daughter and we enjoyed the excellent location of the hotel! We could go anywhere easily and the hotel was nice and clean and the staff very friendly - highly recommendable:-)

title: Reicht vollkommen & gute Lage
text: Wir waren von Mittwoch bis Samstag in NYC. Die Lage des Pod39 ist ideal. 5min von der Grand Central Station und ca. 10 Min vom Times Square. Unser Zimmer mit Hochbett reichte vollkommen und bot genügend Platz.

title: Quality hotel at wonderful location, very friendly staff Great for solo or couple traveler.
text: I have been a fan of the Pod Hotel chain for many years when I travel to NYC. I have stayed at the POD 51 and opted for Pod 39 on this trip. The room was very small (which all hotel rooms are in NYC) with a private bath. The most important thing was that it was comfortable, very clean and I felt very safe. A safe was in the room for valuables. The hotel is located close to restaurants, cafes,  and small convenience stores. The closest subway station is at Grand Central Station which is a hub for many subway lines. Being close to Grand Central, there is easy access to banks as well. The area is well lit at all hours of the night. The staff was very helpful in giving me information I needed  and at the end getting me a car to the airport. There is a restaurant on site that offers breakfast in the morning. It also has a rooftop bar. The water pressure was very good  with no lack of hot water.
